text: This place rocks. Great pizza at reasonable prices.  They have lots of choice and a good lunch special that includes two slices and a drink.  The only negative is its not a very large place so near lunch time sometimes its hard to find a seat.  Overall highly recommended.
We love coming here. The pizza is always delicious and ready on time.  The location is very convenient to us.  Don't try ordering online though, the website is a mess.

Found this place a couple weeks ago and decided 'why not?'  We weren't disappointed. Ordered and got delivery within 25 mins of the call on a Saturday night at 8pm. We ordered a generic pizza (mushroom and sausage) to test it out along with the bbq chicken salad. It was delicious AND filling plus they weren't shy on the chicken in the salad. We'll definitely try this place again, maybe try a specialty pizza.

Pizza was pretty good -- closest to NY style pizza (but healthier) that I've had in downtown so far (am still new to the area, however).  I had 2 slices of cheese, which had been sitting out but were heated and, although not fresh, were pretty delicious.  The two slice and a drink special was $7 I think and the slices were fairly big, so it was a good deal.  The place had a hipster vibe with a relaxing atmosphere, although the music was a little more upbeat than I would have expected.  The live music setup outside was a bit clumsy, as I felt like I was in the way of the musician as I tried to get inside, and the patio is kind of small so sitting outside listening to the music would have almost felt like I was up in his face, but you can't beat live music.  Overall, good experience, good pizza, easy to get to in downtown. Will be back!

I'd eaten here for years. Since becoming gluten-free in late 2011- I didn't think I'd enjoy pizza again. When family was visiting before Christmas we dined in and ordered four different pies. I ordered the gluten-free Provence (capers! artichoke hearts! basil!) Everyone enjoyed their pizza, and we ended up ordering a second-gluten free Provence since everyone enjoyed a slice of mine. A couple folks in my party had wine, others had beer. After we ate, we took the kids next door to Pink Spot where everyone enjoyed ice cream and sorbet.
I've had their "3 Z" lunch special a few times. Usually grab two slices (I've always gotten the daily specialty pizza) and a half salad. $7.99 and it fills me up for hours.

Awesome pizza and salads. The arugula salad is awesome and we have tried their specialty pizzas too and have never been disappointed. They deliver to our office and have always been on time and our order has always been correct. Good job!

I'm all-in with any place that touts organic ingredients, so I wanted to give this place a whirl. After two visits, I'm just inclined to say "It's all right, I guess."  The pizza is more impressive than typical chain pizzas, of course, but both pizzas I tried (first being some Greek pizza and the second a masterpiece of my chosen ingredients) were pretty salty and greasy. I'm a fan of thicker-crust pizzas, Chicago-style and the like, so I wasn't super pleased with these more thin-skinned slices; but if you like that kinda thing..  Customer service here could also use work; it's not absolutely horrible, but both times I went the service lady (two different ones) gave the impression that I was holding her up or something. The second one, who I told we were going to be a second in deciding on our pizzas, said "okay" and stood and stared at us as we uncomfortably perused the menu. Better than disappearing, I guess, but still kind of jarring. The whole staff seems kind of "irreverent hipstery," and I can't stress that vibe of "We have something better to do" more.  The ingredients seem pretty good, though, and there are plenty to choose from for you out there who enjoy a slew of exotic flavors on your pie. I'd recommend it over most pizza places, just say to order carry-out online so you don't have to deal much with customer service and to shy away from any oil-based sauce (pesto/olive oil whatever) so you won't have an oil rag for a slice of pizza.

I'm a bit frustrated. I love the pizza, but the place is always dirty; at least, the past three times that I have been here. The bathroom had mold around the waterline in the toilet and the walls in the dining room were dirty. Now I'm not eating out if the toilet nor off the walls, but it doesn't make you feel good. Today I went to sit down at 4 different tables, having to continuously move due to the crumbs on each table. So, choosing the bar across from the cashier brought me closer to watching how they prepare the pizza. The guy wears no food handlers gloves! Just hands on cheese on my pizza! No thanks! Fare Z well!
At first I didn't think much of zpizza, but after going a few times and trying out a couple of the lunch specials...I'm hooked! zpizza is the only pizza where I look forward to eating the crust.
Horrible. Service, quality, and bowel repercussions. 2 hour delivery time, 2 day toilet odyssey. Not my first bad experience either. Never again!
Love the concept and especially the entertainment on First Fridays!   Fun group of people and excellent musician.

Mediocre at best. The pizza is bland and soggy. The wings are 99% fat 1% Franks Red Hot sauce( maybe franks buffalo) the bread sticks are actually pretty good. The delivery time can't be beat. Pinos pizza is significantly better.

Nice lunch specials and a fun downtown location. Very close to the Van Buren and Central light rail stop. I got 1 slice and a side salad for about $8. The salad had lots of "extras" and was way more impressive than the average side salad. You can also select any slice of pizza you want. They have specials that change daily.
I have had nothing but a fantastic time with both the staff and service! I love the pizza

Ok, I just had lunch there. The place is clean and the staff is friendly, but most of all, I am paying for my food, right?   Maybe I've been spoiled by the Pear Gorganzola salad at the one on Tatum, but I wasn't pleased with my pizza/salad combo today at this one.   The garden salad was actually a lettuce salad with two tomatoes. It was weak. The pizza wasn't as organic tasting as I had hoped for. I was hoping for that fresh taste, but I got a Dominos taste. Disappointed. Maybe I should just stick to the Pear Gorganzola salad. Infact, I am craving that now!

I am not a fan of thick doughy pizza and bland sauce. I almost always order the casablanca for me, sausage for my kid and hubby likes the pesto pasta. The salads are great, and large portioned. It is pricey but I am willing to pay extra for what I think is good food.  Not 5 stars because lately when I order for delivery they have made quite a few mistakes.  Oh I almost forgot! They now have wings, and let me tell you, they are to die for! I ordered two different kinds of sauces and both orders just came with Ranch (doh!) but even without the sauces these were the best wings I have had in a really long time. I am personally not a fan of wings because they are usually overcooked or have a strange fatty consistency and these were just awesome. I would love to try them with some the offered sauces so hopefully next time I get what I order.

How s the Pizza ? I,ve no Idea . After fiquireing out the web site , put in the order , get a call from the store to confirm the order , I waited 1 hour 20 minutes and its still not here . I called the store , Oh he left 25 minutes ago with 2 deliveries . Ok Cancel mine , you can imagine what its like once it get here after 30 minutes . On a Tuesday night There has to be an easier way to get Pizza than ZPizza . Gooood Bye Zpizza !

Trend sucking expensive pizza, come on now 22 bucks for a medium 3 topping pizza.  I especially liked the counter dweeb taking 10 minutes to scan the two twenties I gave him.  Must have had a rash of middle aged men passing fake 20's.  I pass.

Pizza here is pretty good, especially the vegan options.  But that's only if they have them, which they rarely do.  What is the point of having it listed on the menu when I constantly get calls after ordering to see if I still want the order because they can't completely fulfill it!?  Today, I CALLED first to ask and was told they "should" have it.  But they called me after I placed the order and let me know they didn't have it.  This location is such a joke.  The workers are obviously unhelpful when you call in and zpizza has never responded to my emails letting them know this location never has the vegan meat.  I will NEVER recommend this location to anyone.

My fiancee and I stopped by for lunch in-between classes to grab a slice of pizza. We'd been to Z Pizza once before and it was pretty good.  Apparently they had just opened because they had no slices out, and they told us it would be 10 minutes before it was ready. Technically they opened early, a little less than 10 minutes, so I think they were on time with preparation for the most part. The manager made sure to let us know they always try to open early for our benefit.   We browsed the local art (all 'abstract') on the walls, looked at the shop connected which had ice cream, interesting treats, and breakfast/lunch foods, but we ended up waiting for the pizza because we wanted something real and tasty (and less than $4-5 for one item).   One slice of pizza came out to about $3, which I expected since they are smaller and more specialty. The thing that made me happy was that it was a decently sized slice for both of us to share. It was the American, which was awesome. Fresh ingredients, bright colors, REAL thin crust (nice and crispy, yummy even plain), and not as much of a greasy feeling that is usually found in other pizzas that are loaded with too much cheese or whatever.   There was a little bit of a water/grease mixture that dripped off in the first handling, but that is just because of the fresh veggies and meat and cheese. If your meat and cheese doesn't have a drop of grease when cooked, something isn't right. This was in no way soggy or dense with grease. It was really a perfect slice of pizza to be honest.  The only thing that made me worried was a common nat or two flying around. With ingredients that are mixed and prepped on the open-aired counter-tops, that is a worry for me. It's not something very controllable by the employees or store hygiene, so I don't lose customer satisfaction, but I wonder if they ever get baked into the mix every 10,000th pizza. The irony is that there was one in the menu viewing box at the entry. I will stress that the place practices cleanly standards from what I observed.  All in all I know I am a satisfied customer when I don't regret spending my money and time and energy into going somewhere, which happens often. Z Pizza has a nice local, casual feel, not as concerned about a fake approach to you when you are there, and hey, they even warned us that the slice was really hot. It's about the quality of the food/time without being ripped off, and the food quality was really awesome! My fiancee and I would probably come here again for a close-by solution for hunger when we are waiting for our next class.  *If you want a more cafe atmosphere, the location on Central is good for that. They have live music near the outdoor seating weekly as far as I know, usually kind of jazzy.  P.S. Thumbs up for having same-priced gluten free options for pizza!

Great pizza! The owner staphan is always friendly and open to suggestions and input. The food quality is awesome! Great ingredients and even a gluten free menu! Service is the best you will get downtown. I try to get there at least once a week.
Bland pizza.  Not particularly horrible nor particularly good.  Staff that cared more about what's playing on the tv screen than keeping the tables clean.  But a nice space otherwise.

Good pizza, fresh ingredients, and lots of healthy alternative options on the menu.  The only bummer with them is that they are so popular that my delivery took over an hour to arrive.  They gave me a call around 11:30 am to let me know that my order would arrive a little after 1 pm.  I appreciated the call and I'm glad I waited.  The pizza was delicious, as was the hummus plate I got, as well.    I recommend giving them a try, your belly will thank you.

They apparently closed at nine tonight. But stayed open just a few minutes past so I could pick up my delicious. Crispy made to order pizza. And pear gorgonzola salads.  A Tuscan pizza and added sausage. We ordered it crispy when i go there the woman was concerned she over cooked the pizza and already had another one cooking in the oven! But i liked the one she had ready to go.  I almost walked out without my salads but she ran after me and made aure i got them.  The blonde haired older woman was berry polite ready an willing to please The place was clean My order was correct I am now full and happy.

Food is a tad high but the wings and pizza as well as the calzone were good. The  help was friendly and out food was HOT when brought to the table.  The music was actually decent and not to loud. The place seemed clean and they had a steady business for a Sunday night

I have been debating on posting  a review for quite a while on Zpizza, I'm torn.  On one hand, their pizzas are addicting and delicious. Their (usually) perfectly crafted and aesthetically pleasing. The best thing about them is the variety. Its no longer cheese, pepperoni or sausage, they bring new elements to the table.      BUT, on the other hand, the one thing they are truly lacking in their business is genuine customer service and communication among themselves. About 2 months ago, I ordered two simple pizzas, the Thai (my personal favorite) and the ZBBQ (my boyfriends personal favorite). Because neither of us eat meat, I simply asked them for NO chicken. I have ordered from them many times, so I wasn't the least bit worried. I waited 45 minutes for it and when it arrived my pizzas were both covered in chicken, so we obviously couldn't eat them. I called and spoke with a manger just to say "Hey, this kind of sucks!" she then told me sorry and that I can have a free small pizza.  So, still being hungry I decided to place another order (why not?). 45 minutes later I receive the same order and even tipped the guy generously for having to come out again. Well, what to you know, there's no chicken! But wait, there's also nothing else on the pizza except cheese. Awesome.  Twice in one day on the same order. This has also happened several more times since.  For me, customer service is a big part of running a business. If you keep screwing up orders because you fail to communicate with your team you're going to lose valuable customers.

This place has something for everyone.  I ordered the Pick 3 option: a slice of pizza, salad, and half a sandwich. All for $8.  The meal was very good and I will be back.  I have to admit I expected less from this place, but I was proved wrong.  It's not your ordinary pizza joint.  Very good food!  Pizza was thin and delicious....

Love zpizza.  Where else can you get cremini and shitake mushrooms, truffle oil, capers or eggplant  on a delivery pizza?  And, the crust?  It's yummy.  I like it in wheat . .. it's a little crispier.  And, their flour and marinara is organic, which can't hurt.  And, last, the XL pizza is huge.  WTF is Dominos, Papa Johns etc all excited about their piddly 14" pizza made out of crap?

End of a long conference day and all I wanted was a pizza! Zpizza did it for me! Delivery was ridiculously fast and they had this delicious pie with sweet corn and spiced chicken.  My first pizza with corn I had in Europe a couple years back and I've never forgotten it. So if you're downtown Phoenix and need something fast and tasty give Zpizza a call.

Go there at 440pm the cashier in front told us sit and he would take our order. Ten minutes later brought our drinks. My wife order a glass of water and received this picture. It was in total 44 dollars. A xl pizza and 16 wings when I received the food. I asked clearly is everything in there. I asked is the Parmesan and peppers in there with napkins. And is everything good with the wings? The guy said yes. I get home excited been wanting to eat pizza and I opened my wings and no sauce. The wings were dried. So I had to make my own sauce at home lol. I called them and the cashier answered the phone. He didn't even say anything. I'm upset. You only had one job? Make sure the product is good. For Gods sake. You got a raise with minimum wage going up a few dollars in az and you still do a lazy job. Ugh! Never again will I go there. Thanks for ruining it.
Ordered the Berkeley Vegan pizza here recently.  Very good -- lots of veggies, and came with Daiya vegan cheese on top also!  The crust was a little but underdone, but still good.

In keeping with my promis to only review places that deserve 1 or 5 stars, here is a 1. This places blows... Is "organic" code for "shitty"? Seriously frozen pizza is better than this place.... undercooked dough, bland sauce... eesh....
Z pizza SUCKS hands down! Management, owner's, employees and food can alllll go to hell ..save your $ and the stress form this unprofessional nasty ass'd business ....buyer be ware.

I really wanted to like this place. Sadly, our pizza was cold and underdone. It didn't improve, even after being put in our oven. We ended up throwing it out. Two stars for their use of organic and local ingredients.

When I have the craving for pizza, which isn't that often, Z Pizza is the best spot in Central Phoenix.  Our guilty pleasure is ordering on Tuesday nights when it's buy one, get the second for $5 (or is it half-price?  some kind of great deal)....and eating pizza while we watch Biggest Loser.  I'm always a fan of pepperoni, and their crust is crispy thin...the best way.  Also like the Casablanca...artichoke hearts, mushrooms, ricotta, parmesan, mozzarella...so tasty.  Great to have Gluten-free crust as an option, and the ingredients are fresh.  Yes, it's a small west coast chain...but they do it "right".   Friendly staff, speedy service, easy location.

Ask if they have the apple pie pizza. It is decadent.  We usually get home delivery from zpizza.  Yesterday we got a vegetable calzone, salad and wings. Everything was as expected and temperature perfect.  Try the BBQ wings - they are sweet, crispy and not overly sauced.

Zpizza is pretty good. They do use fresh ingredients. Wings are frozen and oven baked. So they're soggy, they're not all fat, just soggy as all hell. If you don't like the texture of soggy wings, stay away. I'm okay with them and they do alright when I'm in a pinch. The Casablanca pizza is amazing! They have some really great specialty pizzas. Where as many people have Pizza Hut or Papa John's as their basic delivery pizza place, I like to choose Zpizza.

I usually really love the vegan pizza, but today I got it by the slice and it was horrible. I got it to go and when I got home 5 minutes later, it was cold. I don't want to give them less then 3 stars because I really like the place. But I spent way too much money on cold pizza that didn't taste good anyways.  I'll probably go back, but I am never getting pizza by the slice again.

My family and I went there last night to celebrate my cousin  Graduation.         It was probably 20 or more of us my aunt suggested we are hispanic we weren't  to happy with the idea of going to a pizza place. But Hey surprise we got the best pizza ever Ham & Pineapple , Mexican with avacado pizza we order a big salad bowl more than enough for everyone my parents were at the bar they all got to try and pick from the draft beer , we were all very thankful everyone was very friendly and attend, a very warm and nice place to have a nice dinner with your family I will definitely go back ...

Z pizza is my favorite cheese pizza ever  and I have lived all over.  I have always had good service, good delivery from this store. In the past the salads I had were relatively sparse on the toppings, but the ZBQ salad I ordered tonight was great. In the past I have had a few pizzas that were overcooked and a little charred on the crust, but overall I really like this place.  They also support local artists.  I will forever order pizza from them!

They have interesting combinations like curry chicken and yams, pear and gorgonzola....sounds bizarre, but is so flavorful! The traditional choices are available as well, along with great salads and unique sandwiches. Organic whole wheat crust and fresh ingredients make for a great pizza! Friendly staff is an added bonus.

Short and sweet if you are looking for a GREAT to go pizza with organic ingredients and amazing quality these are your guys. Z pizza made me forget about movie night and Im just calling it pizza night now :)
Ordered a pizza at 7:30...it's almost 9 o'clock.  Still haven't seen it.  Granted they have great pizza, but this is ridiculous!  Perhaps one of the other ZPizza locations in Phoenix would do better.

Its not offen im in the mood for pizza but this is a great option.  They deliver, it seems healthier than normal pizza (eventhough its prob not), and they have great unique pizza toppings.  Give it a shot...if you like the "california" style pizza you will like "Z"

My family and I were visiting the area after flying to Phoenix for surgery at BNI. We just happened to see this place on the way to our hotel and decided to hop on over for lunch.  The pizza was top notch, in my opinion. It's obvious they use quality ingredients, and their salads look good too.  The only complaint I have is that the price was a little steep. It was $50-something for one XL pepp pizza, one L pepp + sausage pizza, 3 bottles of water, and one beer. We all felt that was a bit much, but it was very good pizza.   I also liked that the next door ice cream place was connected to the restaurant by a breezeway. It made it feel more like a community place. I recommend the place for pizza.

We wanted to try something new, and we found this small little place. Great food, the pizza was delicious ( do not order by slice, buy a whole one.. It'll be fresher and taste better). And then if you are not full, the amazing part is that is connected with the pink place, where they sell desserts and smoothies. I give it 4 stars because the employees are lacking customer service skills. But good place overall

There's plenty of pizza-by-the-slice joints for those of us who work downtown, but Z Pizza stands out as the only one that consistently impresses me. Friendly staff, wholesome ingredients, inventive topping combinations and a tasty slice are enough to keep me coming back, and two slices and a drink and a drink always seem to cost a buck or two less than other downtown pizza joints.  Lately I've been throwing side salads in the mix with the No. 2 lunch combo. Fresh tomato slices, shredded carrot and red onion on a hearty bed of field greens all taste great with the balsamic vinaigrette. With one slice of sausage and mushroom, it's a filling meal with significantly fewer calories than the two-slice deal.  Sometimes I'll order a whole pie to take home for dinner (the Tuscan Mushroom is one of the most inventive tomato-free pizzas I've ever had), and it's always a hit.  Bring your coworkers or classmates here for lunch, and they'll forget wherever it was they used to go for slices.

Good pizza - crispy crust,tons of toppings, and some creative combinations. Stopped in when stranded at the hospital across the street and would happily go back to this location or try the other locations.
Good pizza great service the cashier girl is very nice and polite she has a great smile

This place really needs to be trashed more.  zpizza is a fraud in too many ways.  It markets itself as a sort of whole-foods, higher-end, indie urban culture-vulture sorta place.  It wants you to think it's a cut above.  And it's none of the above.  It's in reality a corporate franchise chain, with a few tweaks to its menu to make it look a touch Berkeley.  It's in a rather inaccessible part of north-of-downtown Phoenix, but they deliver.  The prices it charges for pizza are an outrage, their ordering system goes down too often, and they deliver a cold $25 pizza and then ignore you when you complain.    The ingredients it uses are largely not organic, but they want you to think they use high-end ingredients.  If the flat flavor of their pizzas is any indication, their ingredients come off the same Sysco truck any other middling restaurant's groceries do.    One time I tried to order online, the system choked.  I called and they said, "We're sorry we're closed - our ordering system is completely down."  On a Saturday evening, they couldn't do business without computers.  Wow.    Another time, I ordered an American large, and discovered that they charge a lot extra for everything you add to your pizza.  And everything comes in the most paper-thin slices, so thin you almost can't taste it. I had never experienced see-through tomato slices before, and it was also my first encounter with windowpane pepperoni.  The crust is chewy, which is ok.  But there wasn't much food on my pizza.  It was thin and meager and not satisfying.  And it cost a lot of money.  Oh, and the sausage looked like perfect little weasel droppings, smooth and brown and perfectly formed, as if by machine - or by rodent.  They have whole-wheat crust and gluten-free crust and too many salads with stinky cheese in them and fruit too I think.  So if your probation officer said you have to eat more pear and gorgonzola gluten free pizzas with extra arugula, well, you can stay outta jail one more week.  Next time (why did I have a next time?) again, online ordering is down, but they take phone orders.  I am given a 30 to 40 min del'y window.  After 60 mins I call and ask.  Am told it's on the way now.  It arrives 20 mins after that.  I grab the box and it's cold.  I mention to young street-urchin-looking delivery hipster that my pizza appears cold.  I ask him to wait a sec while I open and check the pizza.  He bolts away and into his car before I can ascertain that I have a cold pizza and cold wings.  I wonder what the delivery guy was up to all that time?  My pizza had been baked some time before.  Perhaps he had been too.  While the slices were microwaving, I called zpizza to discuss and was told manager is unavailable.  Message is left for call back.  I also left a detailed accounting on their online form, and I never heard from anybody.    Again, people, this place tries to whore itself out as a high end, even crunchy place, the kind of place you'd take your lesbian-married-with-adopted-Chinese-baby friends, so you could look just a little less pathetically uncool than you really are.  But it is just another chain using smaller amounts of the same goods as everybody else, adding a few upscale salads to the menu, and charging 40% more than everybody else.  And they have unacceptably poor customer service.  Go to Pizza Hut.  Really.  Aim low and you won't be disappointed.  Oh - and Pino's next door has good and more authentic pizza too, but you gotta pick it up yourself.  Or if you can, get Rosati's - the real Chicago one.

After my so-so experience a few months ago I had the chance to try zpizza again today with a group of friends. The Napoli pizza I ordered was absolutely incredible and I would have eaten the whole thing by myself (large) had I been able to! I will coming back every time that I'm in town to get some amazing pizza.

Glass they gave me for my wine was way dirty. When I asked for a clean one he could not find one. He had to make one by whiping it out. Then I had to pour my wine in as he did not replace the wine. The dueling tvs were annoying also.   Pizza was interesting but a bit too greasy

The gf and I came for dinner on a First Friday. We had purchased a $19 groupon for 2 side salads, an appetizer, small pizza, and $20 worth of beer. It ended up being plenty of food and beer, especially for less than $20. Neither of us drank $10 worth of beer and we had leftover pizza. The place wasn't busy at all and the wait staff was very friendly. We would definitely go back.

i love z- pizza! its so nice having a pizza place that makes vegan pizza for us lactose intolerants! the berkely, or vegan, was so good. a little bland because its made from soy cheese, but if youre taste buds feel theres really something lacking, its nothing a little pepper cant fix. i moved to sf a year ago and before i moved i went here and had their pesto-penne dish as well, and that was amazing.  speaking of san francisco, what's with the lack of vegan pizza options there?! im glad i moved back to phoenix and had the pleasure of eating z pizza AND pita jungle in my first 2 days.

Exotic combinations of pizza.  From to A to Z, Z pizza is Z best!!  Must try the thai pizza and the Napoli one.  I love that the pizzas are all from organic ingredients, making the flavors much more intense.

Z Pizza is good pizza.  Every pie I've tried has been super good, and they deliver ($20 minimum order).  They also deliver salads and cookies, which is nice if you want a whole meal or if you're having folks over and you want to serve more than just the pizza.  Just thinking about the fresh (and often organic) toppings, good cheese, and their crunchy, yummy crust is making me so hungry!  It's obviously a matter of taste, but I far prefer Z Pizza's crust to the thin floppy kind.  Let the hate mail begin.
This is a great place for lunch. I always get the 2 slice and drink special. Can't go wrong with awesome pizza.

Pizza here is too salty and oily.  They don't really do less cheese when asked.  Plus expensive - personal pizza plus very plain side salad = $18!  I do appreciate the soy cheese, soy burger and whole wheat crust.  And the folks are very nice.  But the pizza quality could be better.  Plus, better hot sauce!  All they have is some runny mildly hot stuff.  What is pizza without Sriracha?

Came in from out of town and wanted a quick bite.  Stayed at the Hyatt about .25miles from store. Called for delivery of a small pizza.  Had to order more to satisfy delivery minimum. Was told 30-40 minutes.  Over an hour later called back and was told store was closed.  Asked where my food was.... he just left.  Got the pizza and it was Luke warm at best.  No apologies for being late.  Don't recommend them.

Let's just say that if I could give less than one star I would.  I had ordered here once before and it took them 1 1/2 hours to deliver.They had given us the pizza for freeso  I decided to give them a second shot.  I ordered on a Tuesday night (not like a Friday or Saturday) and after over an hour I called them back and they stated that they couldn't find my address (keep in mind they had delivered to me before) and I live near major landmarks that any GPS can find.  Then afterI called and  read them the riot they said that I was out of their delivery area, but they were going to go out of their way and bring it to me.  As I am sitting here over 2 1/2 hours has gone by and STILL no pizza.  Neddless to say, I will not be ordering from here again.

I made my first order from zpizza without checking yelp and now that i have, I'm kind of surprised by the 3.5 star rating.   We've had zpizza delivered a bunch of times now via Grubhub and the pizza is always yummy with good ingredients and quick delivery.  Can't go wrong with the zbq and they also have great pesto options. We'll keep going back for more.
Love the Napoli pizza.  So fresh.  Add some sausage and it becomes a meat lovers pizza.

Finally, a pizza place that delivers to the Grayhawk area. Seriously, when I moved here over the summer and was unpacking I was shocked to learn that no one except Domino's delivers to Grayhawk. At all. Now, on my honeymoon in October I was in Giza, Egypt and saw that, if you stand with the Sphinx facing your back, you can see a Pizza Hut. Yes, that is correct, you can get pizza delivered to the Great Pyramids and Sphinx, but not to Grayhawk.   But, now we have Zpizza, and it is good. The pizzas range from the usual to more inventive things, such as the Casablanca, which has artichokes. They also feature organic and healthy selections, such as soy or low fat cheese and wheat or gluten free crust. They salads are also fresh and tasty and, while I have not tried them, they also serve sandwiches.  Overall, a good pie, wide selection and it delivers!
The pizza is fine, and always fresh. Nothing too fancy or amazing. But it hits the spot.

I have really loved z pizza in the past, but the last two times I have been quoted a delivery time and it has taken twice as long, over an hour and a half both times. The first time I thought it was a fluke so I gave it another chance and the same thing happened. We will be eating delivery pizza from pizza a metro from now on. Same quality pizza and much better customer service.
Alex is the man! We had a great time tonight! Excellent customer service. Def will be back.

I know for a fact there are GMO foods at your restaurant. I knew the last owners and I know for a fact that you have changed vendors, change the portions, change from yeast, salt, water and flour for the pizza dough to some kind of enhancement packets. You can't even pronounce the ingredients. Don't lie. Mark and Julie didn't go by what corporate said. They did what is best for that store and their customer base they've had for years.  So don't blow smoke in my face. I know the truth.

We love this place. We eat here every year when we visit Phoenix. Very kid friendly. Great salads. Since they do pizza by the slice too everyone gets what they want. Best part is it's attached to the Pink Spot.

We had high hopes for Zpizza.  I loved their selection of pizza combos, crusts, and toppings - and then I tried the pizza....  Bland, cheap with toppings, metallic sauce - no wonder they offer so many combinations, they're hoping you find one that doesn't suck.  Droopy, soggy crust too - maybe they should worry less about their website and more about their food.    The kicker tonight was to find out that they don't deliver their mediocre pizza outside of three miles.  This means they don't deliver to most of DC Ranch and none of McDowell Mountain Ranch or Windgate Ranch - genius.

There are so many things on this menu that I love - the pizza is delicious, the salads are fantastic... and now they have beer!!!   I remember when they had room for two tables when they first opened, and now - wow - after the expansion, it's just a great relaxed place to hang out.    Wall-to-wall people over the lunch hour, no surprise!   YUM.

Very nice whole wheat pizza crust options, love the taste. I am allergic to white flour and don't prefer gluten free ( loaded with potato starch and sodium  sometimes unless they are made of whole grains like quinoa, brown rice and gluten free ) and hence opt for whole wheat. There are only few pizza joints offering that and hence z pizza is great for folks like me.

I just took my kids to Z Pizza today and had a HORRIBLE experience. A man who identified himself as the owner practically accosted my 4-year-old. My son was holding 2 plastic knives, not hurting anyone, just holding them in his hands, when the owner charged in, snatched the knives from my son's hands and proceeded to scold him. Not only did he yank them from my son's hands rather violently, he scared the b'jesus out of him.   This was an outrage on many levels...  1) The owner charged in madder than hell. He let his anger scare a young child 2) The owner should have spoken to me first. Never were my kids unsupervised, I was sitting right there. They were doing NOTHING wrong, just being energetic boys. Let me remind you: this is a pizza joint, not an upscale restaurant 3) Even after I told the owner to stop touching my child, he continued. UNACCEPTABLE. You do not yell at or assault a child. I would file criminal charges, but I don't want to put my kids through an ordeal. This man obviously has anger issues that need to be dealt with. My message to him: Stop picking on innocent little kids!  There is no PERHAPS, the owner absolutely should have spoken with me first. My child was shocked at the way he was spoken to and is still very upset by the event. The owner let his anger get the better of him. PERIOD. And for that he should apologize, not chastise

Pizza is good. Service is ok. When I tried to cash in on the free pizza slice on yelp check in, they tried to charge me $2.50. Something about how it rang up in the computer. Other than that, this is a nice cozy pizza joint with flavorful fresh items.

The good things about Z Pizza: It's open late, it's close to downtown, and they have vegan options.  The bad: It's a chain, they have like 6 parking spots, and the crust sticks to your teeth.  Seriously.  Also, I don't know if it's the type of vegan cheese or the way they prepare it, but it's just not that good.  It looks and tastes fake.  Pizza Heaven does it better.  This place gets the job done...but BARELY.
Good pizza. Great fresh ingredients. Good thickness on crust. Even taste good the next day cold.

Amazing variety of pizza. Very good crust, creative toppings. Totally worth the price. More like CPK than Papa Johns. Go for speciality pizzas, not just cheese and pepperoni. Only been once, but highly recommend the Thai Chicken and Mexican Pizzas.  Customer service is wonderful! Very nice staff!

I am a frequent customer at the nearby Blue Burger Grille (which is amazing) and have always seen this restaurant from the car. As a person who is a vegan and has always hated pizza, I never gave much thought to Z pizza. One day I was searching for some new vegan hot spots (on yelp!) and came across Z pizza.   I went to their website and to my surprise they had a vegan pizza called the Berkley Vegan. That night I called in my order and had the BEST vegan pizza of my life! Super tasty and not at all greasy. This is a must try for vegans and non-vegans too. Will definitely be back!
Great pizza, especially if you're out to feed a vegan. Yelp needs to make this $$ instead of $ on the price. It's well worth it tho.

First time here , was pretty good. It was a little confusing trying to figure out the beer thing with the bracelet at first , the manager was more than helpful in that area.( the girl at the cashier said she would come over and help with the tutorial, but a line of people came in and I was wondering how to use this bracelet) it's kinda neat once you get the hang of it , wave your bracelet at the Z at the tap you want and your tab accrues as you pour your own beer , keeping track of your ounces. Can try them all a little if you want . Pizza was good and the wings are fantastic!!!! Definitely try this place if you are down town Phoenix. Order the pick 3 and it's affordable and delicious.

Ordered a calzone and salad for delivery at 11:09am and it is now 12:26pm and I still have not received. When I called to inquire they said they still had 3 more deliveries and that they can give me a discount on my NEXT order. At this point this order should be FREE!!!!

I've had a love/hate relationship with zpizza since moving to the valley almost a year ago.  I like the idea of a healthier alternative to pizza and the salads are also delicious.  The combo with a slice, salad and drink is a great deal and I've eaten there many times for lunch or dinner.  I've always found the pizza to be OK...not great,  but just above mediocre and with the good price and great salad, I've found it to be a good option.  It's also nice that it's (usually) fast, so you can eat there in 30-40 minutes if you choose a pizza slice that's already prepared in the case by the front.  This was the driving force to my husband & I choosing to eat there recently.  We had an hour to get to a theatre show and needed dinner.  zpizza was on the way, so we decided to try it.  There wasn't a line to order and the dine-in area wasn't very crowded.  We both ordered the salad/slice combo.  While ordering, a 1/2 pepperoni 1/2 something else pizza was placed in the case.  I asked if the pepperoni slices were available (as they weren't on the sign) and the cashier said yes.  We both ordered pepperoni slices and paid and sat down to wait.  And wait we did....salads took a bit longer than usual and when they brought my husband's it was covered in dressing although he had specifically ordered it dry.  I think the guy expected him to be OK with it and eat it anyway, but he really doesn't like dressing.  He sent it back and had to wait again.  After finishing our salads, still NO PIZZA.  I went up to ask what was taking so long to heat up 2 slices, and was told that the pepperoni was not available so they were making a new pie.  I told them we picked it b/c it was already made and we were in a hurry, and they were now telling me 10 MORE minutes for the pepperoni.  I asked to switch our slices to the Napoli which was in the case, which they did.  They heated those up and served them with an apology, but a rather apathetic one.  Unfortunately, those slices didn't taste great, but we choked them down and ran out the door to be barely on time for the show.  I just don't understand why they couldn't have told me the slices in the case weren't available and that there would be a 25 minute wait.  At that point, we could've ordered a whole pizza or chosen a different place to eat.  Also, the employees all seem a little bit snobbish and don't seem to care a bit about customer service.  I think I'll be taking my pizza business elsewhere in the valley, which is unfortunate b/c zpizza is so close by.
I ordered 2 times from that place and got lazy service, late delivery and cold pizza and I do not recommend that place

eh.  bad service.  One night my family and I went in about 40 mins until closing, and boy did they look UNHAPPY! Seriously though..40 mins til closing time and they couldn't muster up a semi-sincere greeting. Whatever.   I can't even remember the pizza.

Delivery is slow.  The delivery people NEVER offer or LEAVE pepper flakes or cheese.  In the case of wings they deprive you of any blue cheese or ranch sauce.  They are consistent in these omissions.  Must be a cost saving strategy....sucks

My boyfriend and I walked into zpizza less than one hour before they closed. We were greeted friendly at the door and warmly welcomed. We did not feel rushed, and were even encouraged to stay past closing to relax enjoy our meal. If our meter wasn't running out, we definitely would have stayed! They had a nice beer and wine selection on tap that is self-serve. The prices was very reasonable. We only eat gluten-free pizza, so we ordered that and it was awesome! I would even venture to say probably the best gluten-free pizza I've ever had. They had multiple size options which is rare for gluten-free. Thy also had a wide variety of toppings to choose from, and they were very fresh. Highly recommend checking out zpizza!

I am disappointed in Zpizza. It used to be my favorite but the staff might have changed ( i usually order by phone). The last 3 times ( yeah...that's how much i eat there) have been not so great experiences. They have not been their pleasant selves over the phone. The lady who answers is almost always off put and the gentleman with the older sounding voice is not very helpful. How hard is it to take an order you ask? Well, apparently pretty difficult.   More customer service, less bad attitude I say. Don't treat me like a second class citizen over the phone. Just saying. Pizza Heaven for me from now on. Not to mention their delivery is VERY FAST. And the guy who answers the phone at Pizza Heaven actually seems to ENJOY his job :) What a concept   Ciao Zpizza. Our relationship is overrrrrr..  Although I must add, the delivery guys at Zpizza are super cool dudes

I was at work, trapped behind the bar, and we were all out of snack chips...Staaarvving!  I really didn't want to order close to $20 worth of food to get delivered, but as I perused our folder full of menus that had delivery service, I started to salivate when I started reading the Z Pizza menu. It's a very colorful, attractive menu, and had a bright yellow sticker that said "free delivery" (as opposed to Mamma Mia, whom I love, but $2 delivery and $10 minimum, well, anyway, I'm digressing).  What to get, what to get, it sucks when you're just that hungry and all these pretty combinations of toppings jump out at you saying, 'pick me,' Little tomatoes with white gloves were high kicking like Rockettes with their arms linked with Mr. Mozzarella and his top hat and monocle. Wait, that was Mr. Peanut, anyway...So I decided on the Provence, which was described as having artichokes, tomatoes, capers and garlic sauce, in addition to the mozzarella and regular tomato sauce. I love me some capers.  It seemed a queer combination, but I love all these ingredients and was eager to have a little adventure. I called in my order, and the girl on the phone recognized me from the bar, and we chatted about the pizza, decided I should have a little truffle oil thrown on there as well. What arrived, still hot, and perfectly baked, was one of the tastiest pizzas I've had delivered in a while. The crust was so crunchy and the truffle oil had soaked into it, so it was like its own separate hors d'ouevre after I made my way to what I would normally call the pizza butt.  The toppings were tasty, fresh, and the combination was truly a treat. I don't know about the garlic sauce, it was a bit too much, but maybe in a lesser quantity the flavor would have melded and not been so obtrusive. I was a happy Kitty, and the next day, it reheated like a champ for a little lunch revisited. Good stuff, that Z Pizza. Oh, and my favorite was the little Kitty face drawn on the side of the box next to my phone number.  Nice touch.

I really want to give ZPizza 4 stars, but it's just not a 4-star pizzeria. Their veggie pizza is the best out of any 'delivery' I've had but doesn't rival Cibo or even Sauce.    The upside: Good veggie/vegan options. - You can opt for the whole wheat crust for no extra charge (the gluten-free crust is a $3-4 upcharge).  -Their California Veggie and Moroccan eggplant pesto pizza are divine.  -There's an ice cream parlor next door. - Their iced tea isn't awful.  The downside:  THE SERVICE. - We always order and pick up -- and are consistently on hold for more than 5 minutes, often times having to call back because they hung up.  - There are a few people working at this location who clearly hate their jobs. Their attitude and manner is really unpleasant to be around. I get it, you work at a pizza place and you're not that happy... but WHY take it out on the customers?   I came in the other night and watched a guy stand in line in front of me for about 8 minutes (he was already there when I arrived), while the girl at the front was on the phone. There's another register.. yet no one came up to help him. He ordered slices and by the time I told them what I was picking up, added a slice and got my drinks, he was STILL waiting. This poor guy waited 20 minutes just to get 2 slices of pizza that was already premade and in the case! That's just careless service.

Good food and a fresh salad!  However, what stood out was the manager who went above and beyond when I told him I had an interview after lunch.  Wearing a white dress shirt he brought me an apron so I wouldn't get pizza on my shirt.  I will definitely return.

If I could give it negative stars I would. First, the girl that answered had to be around my age. So early 20's. She was rude and didn't seem to pay attention or care. I was told 45minutes to an hour for delivery. An hour and a half later I call to politely ask where my order is and I was met again with attitude and disinterest. My order shows up as I am on the phone. The man on the phone asks if I can give my phone to the driver. The driver was rude as well but was instructed to give me half off my $25 single pizza. I appreciated the attempt and felt bad at sending him away as he was already here. I paid (as well as tipped the driver) and he rolled his eyes and walked away. I open the box to find not only was my half onion have olive pizza incorrect but it was cold, hard, and tasteless. I've worked in customer service for years and have never treated a customer the way I've been treated despite my polite attitude. Super disappointed. Will never be a customer again.

The 3 stars is for the prompt, on time delivery to our hotel, Hyatt Regency. We were not fond of the thin, tasteless, microwave like pizza for $20 (2 toppings on medium size). The pizza probably would have tasted better in the restaurant.

Had an hour to grab lunch during a training, and we ended up here. Napoli pizza was decent, and the ZBQ salad was tasty, but the price was a little ridiculous for the amount of food.  Having a time limit was also a little tough, since it took forever for the salad! Yeah, the pizza was ready to go within a few minutes, but then spent another 10 minutes waiting, and in everyone's way! Outside seating was perfect for the day and provided room for everyone.
Fast delivery and great choices.  I love the ZBQ and arugula salad.  Love that they offer beer inside, but I would like to see some good micro brew rotations and a happy hour to enjoy the patio.

Here's a nice story for you. I've ordered pizzas online through zpizza in the past, so they had my contact information. They sent me an email containing a coupon for one free pizza on my birthday, which was coming up shortly. I went in to redeem my coupon later on a weeknight. One of the two employees working at the time told me that since the coupon came from their corporate office in California, I would have to go there to receive my free pizza. What a jackass. He was a young, hipster-looking guy. Pretty sure he was wearing a backwards baseball cap.  LOCATION: Only good thing about the place, it's downtown. Good atmosphere. PRICE: Too high for everything. Pizza's expensive, beer's expensive. SERVICE: Did you read my story above? Every other employee has been pleasant, but this guy really made me angry.   I cannot recommend zpizza because of the terrible experience I had there. I steer all of my friends away from this place. Better experience at Brooklyn's NYC Pizza or the new place that just opened up, I forget the name. Both are located a couple blocks from zpizza at 2nd Street and Washington.

I always enjoy the pizza here and the staff is awesome. I've tried the wings as well and they are pretty good. I haven't tried anything else but I'd expect the other things on the menu to be of the same quality. Could be a bit cheaper, but you get what you pay for, right? They do have some weekly coupons if you sign up for their email list.

We used the online ordering system, and our pizzas took FOREVER. Ordered at 7:15pm, and they weren't delivered until 9:30pm. The online system gave a 30 minute estimate, and when we called the restaurant, the guy on the phone said the order would be delivered any minute... 2 hours later, still no pizza. Our hotel was two blocks away, and our order wasn't hugely overwhelming--2 pizzas and a salad. When we finally got our food, it was nothing special. Maybe one or two steps up from Pizza Hut?

Some things good. Some things not-so-good. Overall I'm actually a fan of Z Pizza.   Please DO NOT go to Z Pizza if you seek authentic NY style Pizza. That would be silly. Did you really expect a big Italian guy named Vinnie to toss you up a pie at a California style healthy pizza joint? If so, get real!  Please DO go to Z Pizza if you would like "pizza style" pizza with cool ingredients like fresh artichokes or zucchini. I also love the wheat crust or soy cheese options. Plus, they deliver to my house so fuck yeah for that.  The Yuppie Veggie sandwich is SICK in a good way. It's really good! Please stay away from the tuna salad. Yukers. Somehow it was soggy.  The service has always been pretty good although food can take a little while. Good effort!

Zpizza is so good! I order on-line because I work downtown in an office and don't get to leave my desk often. They have a 10.00 minimum charge which I think is pretty normal and standard. Their pizza is so delicious! Crust is soft and flavorful and they put lots of cheese and ingredients! If you order on-line you can make special comments or tell them exactly how you want your order and they make it accordingly. Very good! Love this place!
The best vegan pizza in Phoenix! The Tuscan Mushroom one too was amazeballs!   It was perfect after we did the wine walk and was a bit tipsy! I'm still dreaming of those two pizzas!
Great food! Delicious fresh pizza. Service a little slow. I knocked off a star because they don't recycle. That was a big surprise for a restaurant with organic food.

This place always has great service and the food is good. I do think the salads are a bit pricey for what you get but you can't go wrong with the pizza. The lunch specials for the pizza are a great deal although if you go at the end of lunch hour the pizza might have been sitting there for a bit. Overall a good place for lunch and the people are super friendly.

Acceptable pie, with some out of the ordinary crusts/toppings (eggplant, truffle oil) for a fast casual place. A little on the pricier side of pizzas. I might try the vegan cheese/crust/toppings next time.   Two tips for the reader: -   They were not aware of the yelp check in system, but they gave me a free slice anyway  - It took almost 20 mins to get a small pizza and an order of wings out. There was one other customer in to place, but it seemed like they had several call in orders.
I'm not sure why I held back on the 5th star before.  We've had consistently good service and the pizza is always delicious.
Pizza is decent...not spectacular. We ordered a large and two sodas and the total came to $25. I wouldn't go out of my way to return.

One of my favorite local pizza places! I love the vegan options! Pro tip: log in and order online for specials and occasionally I'll get coupons and a birthday offer in my email because I signed up. Worth it!
Order was wrong and service was terrible.  Was told there was no manager working when I tried to confront the issues. Staff was unwilling and ignorant.

When i lived in phoenix. We came here all the time well at least once a week but usually more.. This location as well as the down town location. We generally got take away from Thomas location only because seating always seemed cramped and stifling. How ever we did enjoy dinning in at Zpizza down town. The pizza from both locations always was delicious. We loved the fact the zpizza offers whole grain. Very few if any pizza places do. Also we appreciate that they use  high quality ingredents. I only wish Zpizza were here. So i could enjoy their yummy pizza again.

The best pizza and service, hands down.  Stopped in for a quick bite Togo, just before closing. We were greeted and assisted immediately with a "happy to help" attitude (regardless the late hour). The girl at the counter was genuine and friendly, offering personal suggestions and awesome service. Our sever was fantastic!  The pizza was so vey fresh and delicious.   It was refreshing to receive great service and not be rushed out. We will definitely be back.

Never again.  I used to be a big fan of Z Pizza but stopped going for about a year.  Decided to order a pizza last night and we were told it would take an hour, but it actually took closer to two hours.  When it arrived, the pizza was lukewarm and tasted very bland with stale/dry/hard crust.  The breadsticks were also hard and stale.  I had to douse everything in hot sauce and ranch dressing to make it edible.   The man who answered the phone was annoyed that we called to complain about our pizza being nearly an hour late, but offered to give us 30% off our next order.  Will not be taking him up on the offer.
Sit down and grab a slice anytime! Love the rich, mouth watering taist of all their pies!

This place is AMAZING! We live right next door at The Orpheum and hadn't really been there since the new owners took over. Went Friday night because we heard the most beautiful music on the patio. The manager and owner bought us a round of beer to welcome us...their next door neighbors. We got to bring our dog to sit on the patio with us while we ate the best pizza... vegan... I might add. But don't worry all the other pizzas have meat and cheese and smelled so good I could see cheating once in awhile. Not only was the food and drinks and music fantastic but we met great people on the patio as well. It's our new Friday night hangout!

I only had the Berkeley Veggie pie and it was very tasty. I personally enjoy pizza about as much as I love love love sushi, so this place gets my thumbs up. Not a heavy pizza (granted we shared a small pie), and the service is very friendly. The price is pretty good because you truly get what you pay for. I would come back in a heart beat. And it's right next to Harumi Sushi which I love!
I love this place. When I go to Phoenix for work I always stop in for a late night dinner. Open late and the quality is high all the way until closing time. Great selection of drinks to go.

The pizza was crisp and delicious. The place is super casual and very comfortable. The staff is down-to-earth and friendly.  I loved the live music from Tom Mein on the patio. It felt great to be able to sit on the patio and enjoy a downtown Phoenix sunset in the spring.  Having beer and wine for sale was nice as well. I will be back to try more of the menu.

For the downtown area this is an under rated option for food and cheap drinks on the weekends.  Live music and a nice patio adds to he ambiance.  Great option for those looking to relax and have a great time

The 3 of us were all very disappointed with our experience. The counter food & drink ordering, wristbands, open tab, non-intuitive electronic drink tap pouring, return to close your tab, getting our own glasses, pouring our own drinks, all the while 6 employees were standing behind the counter - doing nothing, was a bit weird and frustrating for us. We had to ask way too many questions how their process works, that you don't have to ask at other restaurants. We did virtually all of their work, and the bill has a tip line?!?! Oy! Now, let's discuss the food. We didn't order the pizza...We got sandwiches. They were ok...practically no meat or cheese, as compared to competitors! The bread was the only good point. BEWARE: Each sandwich half has hidden toothpicks that none of us could see, that we almost broke our teeth on, and nearly stabbed our mouths with. DANGEROUS. The sandwiches were so dry, I ask for a side of mayo. The counter staff was in such as pot-high daze, it took several minutes to find mayo, only after they gave me another mysterious substance that looked and tasted nothing like mayo. There were 3 or 4 unlabeled squeeze bottles with white stuff in them. (Isn't it a health code that all containers be labeled??) We will never darken their doorstep again.
Don't feel like the normal Pizza Hut or Papa John's but still want something just as good?  Order Z Pizza.  The Pizza will always be good, the only down side they have is that the price is high.

We ordered Chicken Alfredo delivery.  Yuck it was terrible!!!  I added mushrooms, onion, garlic and Parmesan cheese and still it's inedible!  Don't order this!  We had pizza from Z's that was good, this, however, was not!

I don't see a single "negative" review.  zPizza is the best gluten-free option in the Phoenix metro area!! It's a small family owned business in the heart of Central Phoenix. If you don't live close, come anyway. The food and service is worth the drive! While you're there, try a dessert at the Pink Spot next door. Yummy!

Love this place! The Moroccan is in my top 5 favorite pizzas in the nation. And now that they have the self-pour wine and beer system, I'm in heaven. No more committing to a full glass of something you might find dreadful. Here you can try as little or as much of 16 beers and 4 wines as you like! The happy hour is fantastic too, especially since it's all day on weekends. If they had a location in Scottsdale I'd eat here every week!

I wasn't going to review this because so many people have already and most everyone says the same thing... awesome pizza.   I miss working so close to here. The lunch rush is a rush but you get in, you get out. And everyday is different, I can try all their different types of pizza. Personal faves: Sante Fe and Napoli pizza and the chicken pesto pasta.   While the pizza speaks for itself, I do have to give zPizza props for having the best specials.  Cheap daily specials, slice of pizza and a drink (or beer) for about $6, buy one get one for $5 on Tuesdays and of course, the frequent eater reward.   I like a place that offers great food and even more reason to come back.

I went here over 2 years ago on a date. My now fiance took me here on one of our first dates and I had pepperoni and it was amazing, but for some reason we never went back until last light. I am now attempting to be vegan (or just have a more plant based diet) and I tried their berkeley vegan pizza. I ordered it in small (personal pizza) and it was very delicious. You get a lot of veggies for the price you pay ($11) and it was vegan meat crumbles. I am very happy because I love pizza and now i don't have to say good bye to pizza, this is a very delicious substitution over the real thing.

Z Pizza wasn't quite my favorite pizza place in Phoenix, but for delivery, it was the best option for me since I had a ridiculous amount of vegan/vegetarian/allergic to everything friends...It's a California chain, but I don't think many people know that. As Lola M. mentioned, there aren't very many parking spots and the "vegan" cheeze here...might not be entirely vegan. Don't quote me on that though! The only selling points for me were the fact that it was close to my apartment, a friend of mine was the delivery guy, and it catered to those who had gluten and veg issues. My order: Gluten-free crust, Chipotle sauce, soy cheeze, mushrooms, basil, and avocado. It can get pretty pricey, but if you've got dietary woes, then you're probably used to paying a little more.

I (and co-workers; friends) have eaten here so many times over the last 6 years that it's about time that I write a review. Everything I've had here is great; I highly recommend the California salad, add chicken; balsamic dressing.  But every pizza I've had here is great too (a rotating selection), as is the Caesar.  I've also had a sandwich now and again and can't complain. Every once in a while the pizza has been sitting there a little while and is a little dry, but that's pretty rare, especially given the number of times I've eaten there. And hey, every 20 times you get a free pizza - can't beat that. (OK, 20 times seems a little high...)

Meh. This place is alright. I always say even the worst pizza is still good pizza because well, it's pizza.   This place was alright. I ended up getting the thai pizza. The flavour wasn't bad, it seemed fresh. The only thing i really have to complain about is the service. The manager working the counter was extremely rude and treated his employees terribly in front of me. Also, my pizza crust was charred, like black. I hadn't noticed that until I had got to the drive in theater where we were taking our pizzas and couldn't do much since we were all starving by that time. Definitely would be into trying a different pizza place next time i'm in in phoenix.
Great pizza for the downtown crowd that isn't greasy! High quality pizza - love it!

Zeeelicious!   There's nothing better than good pizza and Z sure does deliver!  Thin crust.  The type of thin that's still chewy.  None of that cracker-like, might-be-a cheese crisp kind of crust.  They've mastered the ideal pie base!  Appropriate amount of cheese.  Organic ingredients. Gluten-free options.  But the 'ZBQ' was the choice for me: BBQ sauce, chicken w/ roasted red peppers, red onion, tomatoes, cilantro and sweet corn! Definitely a taste bud tantalizer, plus this joint threw in a generous handful of red pepper flakes and parmesan sans my request!  That right there is worth a little extra doe, via tip.  Also, they've got quite a few original topping combos too: curry chicken & yam w/ mango chutney.  That'll be my next pizza splurge!

I have to say I was not impressed with my pizza from Z's yesterday. I stopped in to grab two slices to go and I could not eat very much. I have had their pizza vefore at their Metro Center location and liked it but yesterday it was salty and greasy and just plain yucky. $6.00 seemed a bit pricey for two slices of cheese too!

First time ordering from here. Delivery took an hour and a half.   The pizza was yummy.   Very disappointed in the Antipasto Salad. It was supposed to have heirloom tomatoes, came with regular. Did not have any onions either.

Just an update real quick. I did email ZPizza about my experience yesterday... They have already responded and stated they would be speaking to the manager at the Scottsdale store about my experience & about the rude delivery driver. I was also asked for my mailing address for some certificates to make up for the service, which I told him I'd be more than happy to use... As long as I can use them at a different location.  I have to admit that made me a lot less angry about the whole situation because they didn't have to do that... So that DOES say something for the company in that they actually care about customers being happy enough to return for them. I thanked him and told him that their pizza really is the best. Bumped it up a star (for this location) due to the company being sympathetic to my disappointing evening.

I love this place and often stop by for the Tuesday upgrade special. Today I called in for pickup as I usually do and my order was confirmed over the phone. I get the same thing every time and they usually just use order history to confirm. When I went to pick up my order I noticed it was much smaller than normal after paying. The super nice guy at the register apologized and asked the guy making food in a hat and with glasses how long it would take to remake it correctly. He obviously heard him but completely ignored him. He asked again 2-3 more times and nothing. Finally the guy in hat and glasses (Jeremy maybe) grabbed the ticket out of the other guy's hand and just started making the pizza over again. I tried to interject and say I didn't have time to wait I just wanted the difference or a cookie or something. The guy at the register was again super nice and I apologized to him for having to deal with the other a-hole in the back. Not only did this guy mess up the order but was as rude as he could have been right in front of anyone viewing. He should be terminated and never be allowed to treat people that way or represent your establishment again

Probably the worst pizza I have ever ate. The prices were alright until you find out you were better off going to little Caesars. The "buffalo" wings had no buffalo sauce aside from one wing and they were rubbery and had no flavor. The pizza I had requested be made fresh but that would not cure the cardboard tasting pizza with what tasted like old ingredients. By far the worst $22 I ever spent on pizza. Another over rated disgusting downtown pizza place.
5 bucks for a slice of pepperoni. Get over yourselves. It tasted bland and boring, I'm glad I only bought one.

My partner and I have something of a special needs diet and we're always missing pizza! Well, these guys said they had what we needed, and boy did they deliver! The pizza arrived hot and delicious, full of tasty ingredients like roasted veggies and perfectly melted Daiya cheese. If I found myself living in Phoenix, I'd probably be here every week.   My only complaint is that the delivery said it would take 30 minutes, but in reality it took a full hour.

This is my favorite place in downtown Phoenix.  The pizza is amazing (even gluten free), the wings are right up there with the best wings I've had in the valley, and the self-pour drinks make drinking that much more fun.  The manager is also one of the most accommodating people I I've ever met.  Definitely 5 stars.

Great, healthy pizza.   Zpizza has a ton of great, fresh ingredients to choose from. A lot of the sauces and toppings are organic too! Additionally the wheat crust is amazing! Oh and to top it off; they deliver.Can't beat that.   My favorite pizza here is Casablanca. I could eat entire one by myself and I am not ashamed of that. Hahaha...  It is a great place in my neighborhood when you want good pizza delivered to your home. Sometimes, you just want to stay in and enjoy comfort of your home in a company of good pizza.   Cuztomer service is grean and place is really neat if you prefer to get out there and eat!

Ordered a couple of pizzas for delivery. Gave them the order and the credit card information. They call back and say we are out of the delivery area. What is your delivery area I ask because you delivered here the last time we ordered. His answer was 5 miles. Oh according to Google Maps we are 3.7 miles from door to door. Oh well.... he said we are not going to be delivering your pizza with his ever so snippy voice. Now that's great customer service and rudeness to boot. I guess they think they are the only pizza joint around. What changed between this order and the last is beyond me. Do your self a favor........go else where. Federal pizza is closer and has way better pizza, but now I have to go get it. Oh well Z Pizza will never see a dime of my business again. There is no need for rudeness.

Midday parking at this place is seriously a joke, but such is the case with a lot of swank midtown lunch spots.   Pizza was great, my East Coast hailing girlfriend gave it a thumbs up, which for an AZ pizza place is a huge kudos. We came to check out both this and the adjoining Pink Spot Coffee and Ice cream. We ate on the ice cream side, so I can't comment much on the decor of the Z Pizza side.   Good ingredients, not the usual suspects, so that is a change. I will pay for good quality pizza, so the price was in line for the quality of the food.  It did a ton of lunch business but was efficient and the staff was smiling and not hating their life, which is always pleasant .

I considered giving Z Pizza one star but I thought I would be more generous than one of the staff members was to me.   In New Times there used to be a coupon for a free slice of pizza.  I saved my coupon as it did not have an expiration date.  One day I sauntered into Z Pizza and presented my coupon and ordered a soda to go along with the pizza.  I was told by the clerk that I could not use the coupon because "too many homeless people" were using the coupon and they no longer honor the coupon.  I am not homeless nor do I "look" homeless.  Instead I was told I could order a special that included two slices of pizza and a soda.  I won't ever forget the woman behind the counter who so coldly denied me my slice of pizza.  I promised myself that I would never return.  Few months later...  I thought to myself "Self, you should really give Z Pizza another try.  Maybe it was just a bad day."  I called Z Pizza and asked for a delivery of a half soy and half regular cheese pizza.  In the past when I had ordered such a pizza, someone from Z Pizza was kind enough to mark which side was soy and which side was regular.  I thought the same would happen. I was wrong.  I received the pizza with no indication as to which side was soy and which side wasn't.  I called Z Pizza and asked about their soy cheese pizzas without telling them my predicament.  I was told "Our soy cheese pizzas are so good you can't tell the difference between regular and soy cheese."  I proceeded to explain that in this case, I needed to know the difference and asked why it wasn't marked.  The woman on the phone asked "How are we suppposed to do that?"  I stated that in the past the soy side of the pizza was marked by a white piece of plastic that served as both to keep the pizza box from caving in on the pizza and it also served to indicate which side was soy.    I asked to speak with a manager after I realized I was getting nowhere with the woman on the phone.  She told me I would need to call the following day if I wanted to speak with someone in charge.  I then asked them to send me a small pizza with only soy cheese as a replacement at no charge.  I was told that they would call me back once they got the ok to make me another pizza.  They called me back and stated they would give me a small soy pizza but that it was on the bottom of their delivery list and insinuated that it was not a priority.  It took another hour for them to deliver the small, soy pizza.  Customer service at its finest?  I think not.  Not only did I have to think for them and offer my own form of compensation for their inadequacy but it was the second time that I had been treated in poor manner.    Save your money.   Come to think of it, I think I give Z Pizza just one star.  I will not bother ordering from Z Pizza ever again.

I went here today for lunch with a few co-workers, and really enjoyed it. Apparently this place is a chain (I had no idea) and they have locations in SoCal, but I've never been; maybe I'll have to pay them a visit once I get back home.  The restaurant itself is a fast-food-ish feeling place with a decent amount of seating. I ordered the 1-slice + salad combo (cheese pizza, caesar salad), and was pleased to find the slices were nice and big and the salad was also pretty good-sized...I hate it when restaurants skimp on their lunch portions. I enjoyed both the salad and the pizza -- I'm not about to claim that they were the best I've ever had, but they were tasty and filled me up, so I'm a happy camper. They also have some other interesting pizzas, such as the Tuscan, Greek, Santa Fe, Thai, etc...the ones they had on-hand today didn't thrill me, but I'd like to go back again and try one of their more unusual-flavored pizzas.  Also, I love the fact that they have their nutrition facts on their website, AND as it turns out, their pizzas/salads aren't terribly high in calories/fat/etc. That is thrilling for me. I'll definitely be back.

Was down in the so-called downtown Phoenix looking for lunch and came across this chain. Did anyone notice how pathetic downtown PHX really is compared to other real cities? Well, the display case at this location is really pathetic and you cannot see any of the pizzas clearly. It looks like a display case you find in a mall. The slices are cut small, but at least they are real slices and not made secret in the back. The specialty slices did not look appetizing at least at 2:30pm on a weekday, but the cheese looked average and that's what it was, pretty average pizza, no oregano in the sauce and a crust that is not to die for, more cracker-like. I think I got two slices and a bottle of soda for 7 bucks. Not the greatest pizza, but good enough for a quick, but forgettable lunch.

Usually, when a storefront or restaurant has signage that it is "Under New Management" I run.  However, a growling stomach and a few minutes to kill before an appointment next door, I decided to try Z Pizza.  When I walked in the door, I saw a turn table, of sorts, with several pizza's in it, and was even more wary. I looked at the menu, and decided to order a couple of slices of pepperoni, and a drink.  Guess what? It was REALLY GOOD PIZZA!  The crust was super thin (which I love) and the cheese gooey and yummy!  There wasn't a lot of grease oozing from the slices, and the flavor was downright fabulous!  This place as "healthy" pizza (ordinarily, another red flag for me...I don't want healthy pizza!) in that their sauce is organic, and they use gluten-free whatever-it-is in their crust.  I would definitely go back for more!

I have officially found my new favorite pizza place in this world.  I'm not huge on pizza most of the time because my stomach doesnt handle all the grease very well, so when I'm handed a pizza thats loaded with toppings and cheese and doesn't come out with that extra 10 pounds of dripping lard on top, I'm a thoroughly pleased little camper.    With multiple locations and online ordering, tons of topping, cheeses, bread and sauce options, this place makes it easy to get a good pie.  Its good to know beforehand that this is not a New York style pizza joint, but more of your artsy eclectic CPK type with fresh flavorful toppings and out-of-the-box combinations.  Gotta haves are the carmelized onions and the sun dried tomatoes, and the feta on top was really good too.  In my opinion, this is as close to perfection as it comes with this style of pizza. They are little on the pricey side, but it was well worth it.  I will be going back here for sure, this time getting a large instead of medium to have more cold pizza leftover awesomeness for later!

I was craving pizza and wings and could have ordered from any pizza delivery place but I thought... Why not... Go one up  and get delivery from here.... I ordered wings and pepperoni pizza.... When they got here (65) mins later.... The bag that the wings were in  were translucent... Drenched in  oil.... I said "what is this!?" The driver said oh I must not have closed the bag enough " when I opened the wings up.. They were soggy, covered in  oil to the brim " and freaking disgusting!!!!!!   I'm so mad I paid $10 for these.   Also, the pizza was oily and disgusting too! They must have put about thirty pepperoni on a small pizza.. Which left it beyond soggy.   I'm mad because I never had nastier tasking and looking food than this.

Very good food! Great service! I recommend the California salad! Their new wings are amazing! I order delivery from here all the time, and they're super fast! It's gluten free pizza, almost guilt free pizza

Always friendly, always clean, always fresh, always quick, always delicious. I go here for lunch all the time.  Especially when I crave the yummy pizza creations or the greek salad or even when I'm not sure where I want to go - I know I'll always find something I like. There are always a good choice of pizzas to get a slice from (meat and not-meat varieties) and plenty of choices for your own pie.  My favorites are the Greek pizza, the Napoli, and the one with eggplant and pine nuts.  Yum!  The new appetizer with hummus and pita is also delicious!    I like that you can get the salad and a slice lunch combo, and upgrade to a specialty salad for just a dollar more.  For a while there, I was always getting the Greek pizza and a Greek Salad.  One time, the guy at the register asked my name and when I told him he said, "That's right, I remember now.  I knew you were the "Greek girl," but I couldn't remember your name."  That's when I decided it was time to change up the order. =)  P.S. Go on "Two for Tuesday" when you can get two pizzas for the price of one (not slices) or just one for half price!!

We stumbled upon this pizza place while walking around downtown waiting for The Australian Pink Floyd show (BTW-they're amazing) to start. We were intrigued by the Organic tomato sauce sign & the fact that they had wheat dough. It was an absolute a delight! The thin pizza crust was great & the choices for interesting pizzas/toppings makes it a fun experiment & treat!
