The topper to the experience is that they had some (only a few, but) good choices of beer on tap & offered a great deal on ordering a pitcher vs an individual glass! It was exactly what we were looking for when we ventured out to find something new & tasty!! Only wish we lived closer :(
sooo good! all organic ingredients and it tastes absolutely amazing. A little pricey but well worth good pizza!

My colleague and I went here for lunch.  I've had their 2 pizza combo before and it was good.  This time I ordered the meatball sub and my buddy ordered the calzone.   Forget about it!  I mean really, I wish I could forget about this visit!  First my meatball sub was lousy.  Maybe I'm comparing it too much to ANY place back east, but this sandwich was weak on the meatballs, weak on the sauce and weak on taste.   My buddy's calzone came out ice cold.  When he sent it back, they were really confused why and didn't know what to do.  So they put it back in the oven.  When it was ready, they put a thermometer in it and then displayed it to him.  How the heck is he suppose to know what temperature it should be?!  To top it off, it didn't look or taste like anything special.  Plus in another indication that they don't know how to serve anything other than "gourmet" pizza, the side of marinara sauce he got was ICE COLD.    Service was VERY slow and the staff was not very helpful or knowledgeable.    Stick with the pizza.

I went to Z PIzza out of convenience. It is within walking distance from the ER and the person who was in the ER was irrationally hungry. At 6:30 on Sunday night I walked to Z Pizza to get 4 slices of pizza because it was faster than ordering a full pizza. The slices were awful. They were old. They cost $13. They were only barely warmed in the pizza oven.   If you don't see the pizzas come out of the oven then don't expect them to be good. Lesson learned.

The crust here is the worse, tastes like dirt. The staff is lazy and meh and the wife of the owner writes people on yelp if she gets a bad review being very hateful, instead of changing the tastes of food and hiring older experienced staff. Pizza is pretty gross

I ate here thinking it was a normal pizza by the slice place. I ordered pepperoni thinking that was a safe choice. The pizza was MEHHHHHH... but for $8 it was alright. Barro's is still better pizza by the slice...  THE BEST PART of this joint is the lady who took my order looked like she hated her life and you could see it in her mannerisms.
2 slices of pizza and a blue moon for 9 bucks?  yeah. the other slice is in my frig.. finished the first slice before the blue moon. that says a lot. i just don't know what.
All organic fresh whole wheat pizza. Kinda on the pricey side for a vegan pizza but pretty delicious !
Hard to find.  Great service. Dip was good pizza was slightly undercooked.  Cool self serve beer taps.

There was a bone in my meatball after they burned my sub the first go around. When I brought this up to the manager he said " well we do not make the meatballs here, they come in pre-made". I did not receive an apology or any effort to make it right, or keep us as a customer. We will not be going there again.  It is sad as Z Pizza looks great from the outside, however the food is average at best, barring any foreign items in your meal, and the service is unorganized, and lacking any courtesy.

I love the ZBQ and on Tuesdays they have a special - buy one pizza at full price and get a second pizza for only $5. You can save about $15 on your second pizza with the special - it's quite the savings! Don't expect super friendly customer service here, you won't get it.
Overpriced, boring and dry! Need I say more!

I really enjoyed the Moroccan pizza, delicious flavors!  They have a fun variety to choose from and they threw in some extra pieces of pizza for my friend because we arrived close to their closing time.
Good service, casual atmosphere, pizza was pretty good.

Cool pizza, cool place.   The best thing about this place? It's open on weekends and it's open for dinner, so for that reason it has a special place in my heart.  That being said, the pizza's not very good. The sanwiches and pastas are pretty good, but then again, myabe I'm trying to find something nice to say about this place because, did I mention? It's open late and on weekends!

This is a great lunch spot with well-priced pizza. I have never tried their pasta or salads, but those look good as well. I like that they are housed right next door to the Pink Spot, with an open breezeway connecting the two restaurants. This promotes a friendly, neighborhood-y community feel. We have ordered delivery from them before, and their artisan pizzas are way better than your typical Domino's or Pizza Hut. But I would actually advise to just eat in-store, because the delivery pizza was a little cold. Overall, a great place with a friendly vibe & lots of good healthy options!

I think it's amazing that you can get a vegan calzone, pizza, or sandwich here! The vegan sausage was so convincing I was almost nervous that they accidentally used real sausage!   I'd recommend straying away from the wheat crust. It's got that subway bread smell. For $10 the calzone was larger than my face! I'll certainly be back to try it with the regular crust. The marinara itself was delicious and you can add a copious amount of vegetables without the extra cost.   Do: cheat on your diet and get regular crust Don't: be "healthy" and get the wheat option  One thing to note is that this is your average pizza place. It's nothing fancy but sometimes you need a good old fashioned slice of pizza. I used their check in offer on yelp to get a free slice.

Not my kind of pizza.  I found out after I ate that this is an all natural, organic type of pizza place.  It did tast very fresh, fresh tomatoes and toppings but I like more garlic, oregano, a little more zip in flavor on my pizza.  This was more california (as advertised, I found out later) and I like chicago style so not a good mix.    If you like organic, I bet this is all you so don't let me steer you away.

It is the best pizza.   Great for all types of people.   Vegans, vegetarians, gluten free and all natural.   My daughter got my husband and I hooked a few years ago and now I can say is the only pizza place that we'll go to.

Pouring your own drinks was a lot of fun! The quality of the ingredients is phenomenal. We had the pear/Gorgonzola salad, California salad, Thai peanut wings and the garlic chicken pizza. All of it was excellent. We will be going back and taking our friends. Pretty good selection of beer and wine.

This place is okay for the price. The pizzas taste a lot like back home in Chicago. Love that they have gluten free and more green options. They are nice people and the service is pretty great, which earns most of its ratings.  Pizzas are kind of expensive, though. Their salads aren't really all that special.  Also, figuring out their menu online is impossible. You have to sign up just to look at it, and honestly I don't need any more emails about anything in my inbox.  I also have spent at least $5 on a meal at least a dozen times, and I haven't forgotten about giving them my phone number but my points towards a free pizza don't add up. I wish this was somehow fixed because I feel I would be close to some free pizza, but alas I will likely continue to eat here.

Yet another place I only choose when at work, having either forgotten or been too lazy or rushed to bring in my own dinner, and want something delivered instead of going out.  Happily, I don't special order anything - and my last couple orders have been the pear and gorgonzola rustica pizza. It's tasty. It's fresh, and it's filling. I think it's overpriced for what it is, but we don't have that many decent delivery options, so I'll deal with it.  I attempted the hummus once. Small portion, way too runny and completely lacking in flavor.  The special orders seem to be an issue. A coworker ordered the turkey sandwich and asked them to hold the tomato. That apparently was translated to hold the cranberry sauce, too. Pity - she really likes the cran. In fact - anytime any of us have asked for any "special" handling of our meals, there has been an error.  So - I'll stick with my pear and gorgonzola when the decision to order Z Pizza is made - and hope it continues to be A-OK.

Well. I'm in town visiting and really wanted to try something local. This place is easy to get to and find. The food was just ok. We got a large american pizza with a Caesar salad. The salad was God to me but my friend thought it was a little fishy. And the pizza was also ok. I think it could have used more sauce and more cooking time. But all in all its wasn't bad.
Love Z Pizza! Seriously never had a bad pizza here. ZBQ is delicious!

Went to Z Pizza with a vegan friend hoping to find something on the menu she could eat.  She found what she was looking for and so did I.  I like a good thin crust pizza & this place fits the bill.   I like this place but I have had better pizza in restaurants with nicer atmosphere and better prices.  One thing those places usually don't have is vegan options or unique ingredient choices.  Z pizza is worth a try if your curious but I'm not so impressed that I will go back often.

Visited this location a couple of weeks ago because it was in walking distance from the hotel I was staying at and it got decent reviews on Yelp. I was the only one in the restaurant at 7:00 PM on Monday night, a few people trickled in after me. I ordered a turkey sandwich and wings, both of which were solid. The sandwich was a bit small for the price, good. The service was friendly and fast (not sure if this changes depending on volume). There is an area to eat outside, which was great with the evening weather. I wouldn't go out of my way to return to zpizza, but I wouldn't object to returning if in the area.
A wonderful local pizzeria.  We ordered a Calzone and a small pizza, both were very good and the side of sause was really tasty.

My favorite thing about this place is that you pour your own drinks. Let me explain.. you go in and put down a credit card and get a wrist band. Then underneath each tap ( they have different beers and wines on tap ranging for $.50/oz to $1.25/oz for the wine) and scan your wrist band and pour your own drinks. You can pour yourself and ounce, or 16 ounces of wine or beer. I was particularly happy about the 20% off happy hour and loaded up on the "Not your grandfather's hard rootbeer and the habanero sculpin. I didn't get pizza while I was here.. but I did get their wings- and they were THE BOMB!!! the peanut sauce and pesto sauce were both delicious! Then add the live music on the early Friday evening.. it is a great start to a weekend. check it out!

It was my first time trying Z Pizza, and I really liked it! The workers were really patient in helping me decide which pizza slice to try.   Luckily,my friends and I came in during their happy hour (from 3-5pm, I believe). Buy any drink, and get a slice of pizza for $1, limited to two slices.   I can't remember which specific pizza slices I had, but I do remember that they were delicious :)  Like everything else in downtown Phoenix, there wasn't any other people in the restaurant. It really is strange... And kinda creepy.  -R

My reasons for giving zpizza 1 star is threefold:  1. The service we received was terrible. The employees were annoyed with each other and annoyed with us. I was overcharged, then refunded and given a new receipt that doesn't even match the original total. What type of business model are they running...?  2. "Taproom" is a stretch. Two of the taps were out of order, and three others poured straight foam (that I was charged for)  3. It has great potential to have cool vibe, but the place was just messy and unkept the counter. Unsure if this place is going for hipster Italian pizzeria or a local fast food pizza joint. Either way, it falls short on all ends.   I won't be back.
Z Pizza is one of my favorites in the Valley.  You get two fresh gourmet slices and a drink for $6 something.  They are always friendly as well.  Definitely try Z Pizza if you haven't yet.

My friend and I were first timers here. Alex was AMAZING.  Honest about his favorites, really helpful  on what we should get and overall just very welcoming. The happy hour is to DIE for. Highly  recommended for those HH lovers. Food ridiculously  good and very affordable.  The wristbands to drink 32oz is so good... beer and wine! I'm in love and find myself here a lot  more times to come! Cheers!

This place deserves 3.5 stars in my opinion.   Pros: The staff is attentive, they offer whole wheat selections, and the food has been good and consistent every time I have been in. The pesto pasta is fantastic  Con: I think it is way over priced for what you get. The food is good but not great to warrant their prices. Second, the portions are too small for what you pay for. Unless I am jonesing for a whole wheat pizza, (which isn't often) I will go somewhere where my dollar goes further.

Got me for 5 stars! zPizza Tap Room over here on 1st Ave near Monroe. Industrial cool, convenient downtown, vegan pizza (oh well...) happy hour all weekend! Pizza by the slice, 5-big screen tvs, Pizza-by-the-slice can get a little dry if the turnover is low but its downtown on a Saturday so I'm cool with it. Here's the techy side to all this: you order your food, give them your credit/debit card and ID, select either pint or 24oz mug from a cooler and pour your own beer from 20 different taps! How's this work? They issue you and arm band, you look at a digital screen above furor brand, ABV, etc., touch the arm band to the big 'Z' by the screen and you get 5-seconds to make your pour! If you're not sure about the beer just touch the screen and an in-depth description pops up! I selected a slice of tomato, mushroom, black olive, bell pepper pizza. It was a little dry but tastes good. I've honestly had better pizza. I selected a raspberry beer. Tart and fruity. I like a lot of the  orange beers out there but tend only drink one. This was very good- forgot the brand, sorry. They also have 'Not Your Dad's Root Beer' at 10% ABV. Think I'll try that next with another slice of pizza. The server was totally cool and walks each customer through the process. When I asked for a number for my table he was like, "Don't worry man, I know who you are"  Ric out

This was one of my favorite places to get take out pizza and salad from on a weekly basis.   Unfortunately, it looks like they have closed their doors.  I have tried calling for the past week and no one answers the phone.  I finally drove past the location and there is a note on the door stating they did not fulfill their rent payments.  I am only giving this place a 3 star because of utter disappointment, otherwise the food earns 5 stars! The Gluten Free cheese pizza was the best gluten free pizza I had ever tasted.  They used a thin rice crust with organic tomato sauce and low fat mozzarella cheese.  The place was small inside and lacked much ambiance, but made for a great delivery/ to-go restaurant.    I will miss you Z Pizza!

My boyfriend and I go to the location on Hayden frequently, and this has become one of our favorite pizza places around town. The place is always very clean, the staff is super friendly, and the service is relatively quick. If you like traditional pizzas, they have the regulars -- cheese, pepperoni, etc. -- but they also have some really creative ones, such as the Mexican (includes avocados and even sour cream), the Thai (lightly drizzled with peanut sauce), and the Berkeley Vegan.  I can only vouch for their pizzas, because that's all we've had so far, but their rusticas and calzones look amazing, and I plan on trying something different each time we visit. Also, I love that the Hayden location offers free delivery and 10 percent off all orders submitted online. I can easily put in an order and pick it up on my way home from work! Voila, dinner!
2nd Visit.....very poor. The slice of pizza tasted no better than frozen pizza. Disappointed with lack of consistency. No 3rd time try here. Thanks for reading. The Bike Chaplain

I don't get it. I only go there because it's a short walk from my house and fast (and Pino's is closed for weekends). I've heard people rave about this place. It's about as good as papa johns. Pino's al Centro is almost next door. Go there.

We stopped in one night for pizza and beer to watch the Suns on the TV's around the restaurant.  The staff was so friendly and walked us through the entire tap process - pretty innovative and cool!  The hawaiian pizza was really tasty and reasonably priced.  We'll definitely be back to sample more beer on tap!

Warning: Request crispy crust or you may receive a soggy pizza! My pizza was delivered soggy with toppings that weren't even held down by the cheese! Imagine my struggle trying to eat it! If it had crispy (or at least firm!) crust, I still would only give the place 3 stars. The flavor of the pizza was so-so, and the buffalo wings were greasy and lacked flavor.

Best pizza I've ever had! Really, they make the best tasting pizza in the world, the staff are great, and they have an ice cream store built into the same shop, so you can walk through and get ice cream desert for afters.

My new favorite after work pizza joint! It's in a quieter part of downtown, they have fresh delicious ingredients, and they can customize the pizzas for vegetarian and vegan options. Plus Alex's amazing service made this one of my best dining experiences in recent memory! All in all, a cool spot in a hot city!   Ps: one of the few places that will validate downtown. You all are awesome!!!

LOVE Zpizza!  Their pizza is amazing (ZBQ is my favorite) and different than what you get from the large chain restaurants.  They also deliver and their delivery has always been FAST for me.  I also love that I can get a tasty salad to go with my pizza, which makes me feel a little less guilty ;)

Looking at the last review, it must have been a "bad manager" weekend at Z Pizza. On Friday we ordered for delivery online. One hour later lukewarm pizzas arrived.  The order was wrong. Apparently they manually transfer the data from the online system into their ordering system and completely botched it.  We caught the driver before he left and he said he'd to back right away and the manager would call to tell us how they'd make it right.   Over an hour later, no call.   We called them and spent 20 minutes on the phone. We got no apology, just an excuse, "We're so busy. We've got 30 people in line. All businesses make mistakes."  They offered to write down somewhere that we were owed a free pizza.  Seriously?! Like they'd proved their order system worked well enough for that.   Very poor example of restaurant management and customer service.
Love this place. If you are in the downtown are of Phoenix, you need to get some pie here... Best pizza, cool location... great place  love this one
Delicious pizza, I love the crust. I took my daughter here for her birthday and she loved that there was a couch to eat on and an ice cream place built in :) The wings were good but spicy.

Here is a place that we love to go with the family...We tend to remortgage the house ever time we visit but hey with the current economic crisis who doesn't???  It was a place we went all the time but lately not as often, not because the food isn't excellent but because it is quite pricey.   The service is great, Hudson the manager is great, very friendly and always comes to say hello. He knows us by name and enjoys our friendly banter.  The pizza is VERY fresh, the place is always immaculate and I've never had a problem with the food. If you are looking for great pizza this is the place, if you are looking for cheap well I'm afraid it isn't.   They do have a frequent stamp program and using that will save you a few bucks in the long run.

I have been gluten free for over a year now, and this makes dining out quite the challenge.  You never know if the employees understand exactly what gluten is, or are taking the precautions that you ask.  It becomes this anxiety fueled worry fest, and you don't want to do it.  Unfortunately, we flew back in from Anaheim and it was getting to be quite late.  We were tired, no one wanted to cook, and the kids were cranky (one of them being gluten free as well.)  I turned to trusty yelp to find a gluten free place near the airport.  Luckily for me, this popped up.  Let me tell you, Rebecca, is amazing.  I'm not talking about myself (though admittedly, I AM amazing), I'm talking about the employee.  When I talked to her about gluten free, I ordered a pizza with chicken sausage on it.  She warned me it had gluten, but the Italian sausage did not and would be a tasty substitute.  Way to look out Rebecca, AND have a solution to the problem!  Zpizza, she needs a raise!  Seriously, give her more money to keep her happy and staying there.  The crust was tasty, the sauce was great, and the toppings fresh.  Gluten free and gluten eaters in my family agreed, tasty pizza to be had here.  I would recommend this to people with gluten issues because not only was it delicious, but I did not get sick afterwards!
Wow! De-lish sandwiches!  Great service!  Great selection of beers.  The manager was easygoing and walking around talking with customers.  Great environment.  We will be back!
LOVE THIS PLACE!!!! They truly have really really good pizza here! I've been to both locations multiple times and they are consistent! It's a healthier pizza and it's gooooooood!!!!

Well, I suppose I don't have much to go on.  I mean, we were really hungry (had just finished a 10 or so mile bike ride, and had another 10 or so to go), the place was dead (as in, we were literally the only customers), and it was early on a Sunday afternoon.  So three things that conspired to put zpizza in a favorable light.  Well, that and the super friendly and timely service... and the pie.  The pizza was seriously tasty.  Not the best I've had, but something I would happily eat again.  I'm looking forward to returning to try their vegan pies.  If the Casablanca (delicious and rich tasting garlic sauce- tasted like a roasted garlic paste- artichokes, mushrooms and three cheeses) is any indicator, I shouldn't be disappointed :)

First time customer. Atmosphere nice, customer service good.  We were only ones in the place (it was great they were open, so many other places downtown were closed). We had pizza and pear salad. Portions were very generious, salad was very tasty, loved the Balsamic dressing  - I love they do not use weeds in their salads, but good crisp lettuce (would go back for that alone). Pizza was very tasty, albeit very soggy (had peperoni & mushroom) - must eat it with a fork and knive, impossible to pick up and bite into it. Would love to see a crisper crust on the pizzas.  The lower score reflects the pizza.  Will go back, but will try sandwiches next time.
Z Pizza is pretty alright. What I appreciate most is that they have vegan and gluten free options.
This pizza is next level and the space is cool and chill. My wife loves her vegan pizza. We will be back soon
The pizza is generally pretty tasty and the last time I went I had the pepperoni and I thought it was very acceptable. The prices are also very reasonable for the lunch hour.

I am a fan of zpizza and have been ordering from them for over a year. However, this location has some serious problems. First off I called in a "catering order", specially stating the purpose of the order and how many guest would be attending. I had picked up a catering menu for the location to help make my decision. I ask the takeout staff for 8 catering sized pizzas and a catering salad. I confirmed with her that this would feed 20 people. All well and good. Day of the event the food arrives. The takeout employee hands me the food. I look in the bag a personal sized salad... This is a catering order. We also received and paid for XL pizzas, the menu clearly states large for catering (photo included). The employee left before I was able to discuss the issue so I called the store and spoke with the manager who was rude and offered little sympathy. They then redelivered the catering salad. When I went to meet the take out employee they handed me my salad and 4 completely open salad dressing. He did not mention or apologize for the issue or mess. I am so disappointed in the service and food and being over charged!! I will never be ordering again.

FOOD TASTE/QUALITY:  Okay SETTING:  Nice - outside and inside seating, downtown, great location PRICE:  Outrageous   X-LARGE 1 topping pizza (Pepperoni):  $22  I live right near by.  I'd love it if this place had even fair pricing.  But the pizza is okay to good, if I'm feeling generous, and it's 2x the price I'd expect.  Despite the convenience, I just won't pay the price.  It's packed at lunch.  Great lunch specials for the working crowd downtown.  At night, it does a fair business, mostly to people downtown for sporting events or at the nearby Orpheum theater.  Maybe people just don't care about getting gouged.  But they've got to get realistic on pizza prices.  Especially for carryout, at night.
I've been waiting 2 hours and 15 minutes for a delivery. I keep getting a different story about why it's so late. The truth is that I just don't care why. My family is hungry!
Fantastic pizza, both regular and gluten free. Plus free local delivery. Really good tuna sandwich.

My sister is vegan, so any place we go to has to have vegan options. I've passed by this gem so many times and never gave it a shot. I'm glad I took the chance because the pizza was amazing. OMG, THE CRUST!!!! You know the pizza is going to be delicious if they have nailed the crust. I could not stop eating the crust; it was a perfect balance of chewy and crispy.  I got the pepperoni pizza (boring, I know), but probably one of the best pepperoni pizza's I've had in a while. My sister got the Vegan Brooklyn, and she stated it's the best vegan pizza she ever had. I will definitely be back. Everyone is also very nice and willing to make recommendations.   Plus if you're new to the location, they are doing $5 dollars off if you dine in. I don't know the exact rules, so make sure to ask.   I also did not get pizza by the slice... I'm sure its the same, but nothing beats pizza fresh from the oven.

It was around 6pm on my third day in Phoenix when I was (finally) able to hang out and catch up with two dearly-missed SBC alums, Lynn W and Claire! Originally, we'd set out for the dessert place next door, but I had just returned from a 10-hour day trip out to Grand Canyon and back so a slice of pizza sounded perfect...  The joint looks very collegiate and indie, full of simple designs, bright colors, and decisive lack of branding, although further inspection reveals it to be a widespread, though not yet prominent franchise.  For just shy of $20, I ordered three slices and drinks for our impromptu dinner, myself gravitating towards the simple pesto slice, as usual.  For the price per slice, it seems a tad on the expensive side, but the slice, its flavor and ingredients, is decent. The better option or deal is probably to get one of the heartier sounding whole pizzas [online menu: http://weborder3.microworks.com/zpizza/Item.aspx?menuid=2477]    Nonetheless, it hit the spot and service was very friendly.  There's a cool symbiosis of Z Pizza being immediately attached and sharing a space with Pink Spot next door. ___________________________________________ Savory and sweet in a single space! Gluttony abounds!

This location sells the ice cream that was previously sold at Pink Spot (next door, before Pink Spot closed). Mind you, they charge $6.50 for a pint, which is already a little high, but worth it as it is homemade.   I frequently order from here and always make sure to get a pint of the ice cream. This last time, I placed my order as usual and what do they deliver to my house?... A pint of Ben & Jerry's! For $6.50!?! I voiced my frustration to one of the employees who said he would have the owner call me.   This morning, I spoke with Mark, the owner, who was completely rude. He stated that Z Pizza does not advertise the former Pink Spot product (Well Mark, perhaps you should tell your employees to stop telling customers that that is what it is), and that they have the right to set whatever prices they choose.   You're absolutely right, Mark... You can set whatever price you choose for a "grocery store" product. I can also choose to save my money as a customer and take it elsewhere. And to be completely honest, your pizza is just "ok" and still twice as expensive as ordering from Papa John's... Who btw, delivers in half the time it takes your employees.   Z Pizza just lost another regular customer.

Everybody loves pizza and it was evident today at this Z pizza, There was a line to order, a line to fill your drink, a line to get a table and a line to pick up your food.  Despite the crowd we were in and out in about 30 min. I opted for the #1 combo, any two slices, a drink all for $6.93 with tax. Not great for 2 slices if you get cheese but a good deal for the gourmet options.  I went with one of the daily slices the "greek" A sauce free pizza topped with feta, red onion and katmala olives. The crust here has a decent crunch too it and the chees was cooked enough. There are also some decent condiments, the standard parmesan and red pepper, granulated garlic and a franks style red hot sauce.  Once our names were called we lucked out and got a window bar style seat.  There is a nice patio which may be some use after October, but for a 110 day in August it is just ornamental.  Decent artisan toped pizzas, ok prices and fast service it is a good lunch option for a smaller group.
Pizza was ok....undercooked at first had to request it to be cooked for additional time.  Service was very slow....better places to go
Ugh! Ordered a pizza online, got a confirmation email, waited an hour, called 20 times, rode my bike over, and found a sign on the door that said "Closed on Easter!"
This place has good vegetarian options and is organic! Try the vegan cheese and vegan toppings like crumbles or sausage!

This is without a doubt the best place to get a slice in the Downtown area.  While it is nothing like the slices in NYC (from what I remember when I lived there that is), it's as best as Phoenix can get.  The employees are incredibly kind and everytime I've gone someone has been outside cleaning.   They offer an ASU discount which amounts to $5.44 for 2 slices + fountain drink (with tax).  Also, their happy hour ($1 slices) has been moved to the hours of 3-5 instead of 2-5.  It's worth a shot -- they offer vegan as well as gluten free. And, they tell me they do deliever -- within a 3 mile radius from the hours of 11-1, M-F -- so get your lunch delivered!

I'm sorry to say it but I have never been so disheartened by some bullshit from a local pizza spot. My wife and I have been loyal customers for 5+ years. She has dietary restrictions (gluten-free, dairy-free and soy free) and, for her especially, pizza is a treat. The fact that her small gf/df/sf pizza can run up to $35 is outrageous but we pay the price because it's the best we can get. Not anymore. Screw ZPizza. Last Friday was brutally exhausting for her and I didn't feel like being a chef so I ordered pizza early in the afternoon with explicit instructions to deliver at the time she would be home and comfortable, 6:45pm. At six o'clock, the pizza arrived. I told the driver she was early and her response was, "well, there's nothing we can do about it now." Had I not been in the middle of working I would have ended the conversation differently but I let it go and did not throttle her on the spot. This is not the first, second, third or fourth time we've had problems with orders or restitution with ZPizza. We've forgiven wrong orders, late deliveries and poor delivery service before because we aren't the types to fuss over trivia. But that night I wrote a private message to their Facebook page explaining my dissatisfaction. Thus far, no response. I called them on Monday asking to speak to the manager, again, no response, no call back. It's Wednesday. I've been patient enough. Hey ZPizza! I will never speak your name well again. You have no problem taking my money but you suck at delivering what is ordered. Your dismissal of me as insignificant or unworthy of attention isn't right. Your ethics and integrity speak volumes and your representation of your brand is subpar. I'd say you're cooking up a financial shitstorm and I hope somebody will put you back on track.

I've been here 20+ times in the last year as my wife really likes it. Their pizza is good and they have several interesting non-traditional offerings.  We really like that they use organic and non go ingredients in their offerings. That being said, I'm not sure I can continue to get pizza from here.   I've noticed over the last several months that the service and especially the attitudes of the employees is becoming worse and on occasion somewhat hostile. Tonight was the final straw for me. I was told my order would be ready for pickup between 20-60 minutes. When I arrived after 30 min, it was ready and the girl almost threw it to me across the register. I asked for the salad the id ordered as well and she looked at me as if I had three heads. Reluctantly she walked the three feet and got my salad too. The entire experience tonight put such a horrible taste in my mouth that I can no longer recommend Z Pizza to anyone!     EDIT:  Spoke with Brian, store manager, who recently took over this location. It seems like I got caught in some transitional pains. My wife and I will be going back soon and will update review at that time. Really appreciated Brian calling me and am looking forward to seeing the improved ZPizza!  EDIT2:  We went back last week. Night and day difference!!  Spoke with Keegan on the phone who was incredibly pleasant and friendly. When I arrived to pick up my order, the bearded man who makes pizza greeted me and was friendly too. He actually looked happy to be there. The young lady who was cashier that night was still standoffish at first but slowly warmed to polite conversation. Such an improvement.   Brian, you are doing a great job in turning this place around. I feel I can recommend your restaurant again.

Over a week for horrible customer service...   Customer since 2007, not anymore   I basically wrote them off after talking my dad and family into ordering from them one night instead of Papa John's.  Fresh ingredients and real food right?  But after they delivered it, the pizza I ordered for dad was soggy and undercooked.  (which is alway the worst when you build a place up, finally get others to try it, and get burned!)  2 weeks ago for Father's Day, I was spending time with my dad and asked him what he wanted to do for dinner, he asked for Z's.  I tried to persuade elsewhere, but he just wanted to relax at home.  So I called up and placed an order, then ran to pick it up.  When I left with it, they forgot to put the 2 slices of pizza in the bag (I looked in it and thought everything was there)  Get home, realize they are missing so give them a call.   me-"Hey this is Steve, I was just there, you guys forgot my 2 slices of pizza"   "ya, they are sitting right here"   .....   .....    me- "okkkkkk, well what do you guys do in situations like this...."   "they are sitting right here"   .............   me- " Ok....well we just sat down to eat, and I'm not running back up there right now, so in situations like this, what do you guys do to make this right, have the delivery driver drop them off or just refund me for them?"    "I will add a 5 dollar credit to your account that you can use next time"    me- "uhhh I think the 2 pieces cost more than 5 bucks, so can you just refund my card back the right amount"   At this point I was already DONE with this place, who forgets food then doesn't offer to make it right, THEN lowballs you on a credit?? If you are going to offer me a different amount, At LEAST offer me MORE than what I paid for not LESS!  INSANE    "ok I just did the refund"   me- "thanks man"  that's it, no apology, nothing. He also sounded like he wasn't on point, and after the way he handled it AND originally forgetting my food I was worried about the refund.   I kept an eye on my credit card account, and 3 business days later, still no refund, so I called back up to find out whats going on.  He never did it.   Wednesday:  after 20 mins on the phone, I am told that the owner will have to call me back to investigate this and issue a refund. Odd that NO ONE there can handle this or refund my money    Friday:  Still no refund and no call from the owner, so I call AGAIN and explain it all over for the 2nd time. I was told the owner would have to call me and let me know.  later that day he does, is nice on the phone, says sorry, and that he can't refund me back on my credit card, that I will have to swing by to pick up the refund  once he is done, I explain how disappointed I am and how I waited almost 1 week and had to call 3 times for a refund, after not getting my food, getting a lowball credit offer, and being told I would get a refund and NOT, and that I now have to drive back up there to collect my refund. He has nothing to add but "sorry" and he is "trying to make things better there because there has been some customer service problems"     ------   Well earlier tonight I was riding by, so decided I would grab it (a tank of gas in my bike) so went in and asked for it  open up the envelope, thinking mmmmmmaybe they will throw something in there, like a free pizza coupon to make it right, but nope  6 bucks and 1 penny   If they had thrown a coupon in, I was already mentally ready to ask for the manager and give it back. I don't want their food, or anything FREE, and that it's the principle.   and I thought it would be BOSS to do, give it back :D   but would had scored points in my book for the effort   but NOPE  all of that, calling them 3 times, all just so I can drive back up there to get my money back   so heads up  this is how they treat customers who have gone there for years, who's orders get forgotten, and takes them almost a week just to give a refund   as a business owner, and former manager in the food industry, that isn't how you take care of your customers   such a shame, love supporting local businesses and had recommended them to quite a few people before   so if you are thinking about hitting this one, I HIGHLY recommend you look east, 2 buildings over, Pino's- http://www.yelp.com/biz/pinos-pizza-al-centro-phoenix , and try them out  AMAZING customer service, friendly, helpful, and waaaaay better food  seriously, you can see I gave them a 5 star almost 1 year ago, that's where I've been going for pizza since

What more could you want in a casual pizza place?!  A variety of pizza's on the menu, other items as well.  A distinctive feeling and style.  A happy crew serving you deliciousness.  When I'm hanging around this area again, I'll be back!

First off they were dog friendly, which is a big plus for us.  we had a groupon for four but only 2 of us showed up, and they treated us like 4.  the food was really good.  both salads rocked (ceasear and pear gorgon zola.   the pizza was tasty, and they had a surplus of vegetarian options.  finally there beer selecting was not massive but good.  no cheap domestic swill, all decent to good microbrewies.   The service was above average for a causal dinning experience. btw the way the groupon is an excellent deal!
Garbage.. All if these reviews are people that like vegan organic gluten free pizza.. Show me the meat and cheese!!

This is one of my favorite places to go for lunch in downtown Phoenix for two reasons: The food is good and I love that you can sit at the long table in front of the window and watch the light rail and traffic go by. I really dig their balsamic dressing on the house salad (it's a pretty good size) and the pepperoni pizza is very tasty, not greasy. Oh, and the staff is always friendly and fast.

Had delivery from this location multiple times. The pizza isn't lets say cheap, but with the quality ingredients it's worth it! Kind of like the Whole foods of delivery. They also have sandwiches, salads, and etc... I can't help it though with rustic pizza's and a choice of whole wheat crust I've been stuck on the pizza and I don't want to share! Next time I'm doing half and half because it's so hard to pick just one.  Easy online ordering is awesome! I also want to say the woman who has delivered a couple times seems sooo happy. It's really nice. It makes me want to apply for a job, so that I can be happy too. :)

Had the provence pizza and I'm so glad I got the extra large so I would have leftovers the next day.  Pizzeria Bianco's got nothing on this place.  Interesting ingredients, delicious crust and perfectly baked (not burned).  I definitely recommend trying the hot/bbq-ish sauce they have in the condiment area on your pizza.  Not a ton but a little adds a delicious kick.  Service was good, the place was clean and the food was delicious and organic!  Looking forward to lunch today  :o)

Took a stroll downtown this weekend to try Z Pizza because I'd heard so much about it.   It was delicious. I would have liked a veggie options for slices or at least some veggies on the slices, but I ordered the sausage/mushroom slice and caesar salad... Tasty.   In looking at the menu, there are many pizza combos that I would like to try in my future visits or to order delivery.   The website wasn't helpful as it mentioned that there was not delivery at this location, but there is. So next time I'm ordering to be delivered straight to the pool. Before it gets too cold that is...

After putting out a twitter alert for a pizza place along the Lightrail, my fellow tweeters urged me to check out Z Pizza.  Even before my tweet, when I was at the Mayor's coffee event at the Heard Museum (yesterday), we received the Phoenix Passport Book.   My friend, Seth, told me that there was a coupon in the book and we should try it out.  There's no doubt that Z Pizza had to be a place I needed to try this weekend.  Instead of taking the Lightrail, we decided to drive.  (FYI, the closest Lightrail stop is Thomas and Central and it's only a short walk away.) We liked the friendly service and the comfortable atmosphere.  We ordered the Hawaiian Pizza and it was yummy.  We ordered the large because with the coupon, you get $5 off of a $20+ order.  The large pizza was $20.56.  We ate a few slices and took the rest home.    We sat and ate on their comfortable couch. Afterwards, the setting was so comfortable, we stayed and read our books.  I wanted to try the desserts at The Pink Spot, but I was too full.  All in all, Z Pizza had a nice atmosphere and good food.

What a great find!  My wife and I were in Phoenix for the D-Backs/Pirates game and stopped in at ZPizza on W. Monroe (For other out of town people -- the entrance actually is NOT on W. Monroe -- it is on 1st (the East side of the block)).   We got the meat stromboli and it was really about as perfect as we could have wanted. The dough was fresh, light, soft, and delicious, as was everything inside.   We also sampled a few of the drinks on tap (self-serve taps were great -- ideal for being able to try several different brews, as they're billed by the ounce). I can't remember the names of the ones I tried, but they were dark and they were great. I'd take them over Guinness any day.  The next time we're back in Phoenix we're absolutely stopping again.  Open a ZPizza in Las Vegas! (Actually, it looks like ZPizza may have been here, but closed/left....so come back!)

I won't lie, I was skeptical ordering from this place.  After a long day of painting my new apartment I needed some grub, and looking for a place that delivers to my new digs downtown I came upon Z Pizza.    I have to admit, I was not pleased by the hour+ in between order and delivery.  When the guy finally arrived, he asked me if I traditionally had a problem with delivery people not being able to find my place.  God I hope not!  I can't imagine it's that tough!  He went on to tell me that he had just made a delivery to my building earlier in the day and couldn't find the right building.  Well it says the building name in big letters on the side. . .Figure it out, especially if you get lots of orders!  On to the pizza.  At $13 for a medium cheese and $17 for a medium "Napoli", this is definitely on the pricier side.  And is it me, or is the "Italian Pizza" just a bit redundant?  I was under the impression that pizza itself was Italian.  Anyway, the pizzas were actually really good.  i liked the fresh basil on the cheese pizza, and the roasted garlic sauce on the Napoli was fantastic.  I'm sure I'll be trying their other pizzas in due time.

It's interesting that people love or hate this place...  I don't like that it's a chain - not necessarily cause i hate chain restaurants or anything but moreso because it's deceiving, seems so local and independent (I can get over that tho).  I've only had salad and cheese bread here - but it's been good both times. In theory, I like that everything is organic but really I'm not that much of an organic snob so I could be over that soon too.   All in all, I'd say this place is good - not necessarily great. But I hasten readers that I've never had a legitimate slice of pizza from here. So maybe I just need to give that a try.   Their tea is good!

5 star service and 2.5 star pizzas .. 3 stars overall. Just across the street from work I find myself coming here too often for the diet I claim to be on.  The benefit of ordering in ahead of time is always a plus. The food is almost always done in 5 to 10 minutes. The service is top notch and I cannot tell you the number of times the staff has stopped me from ordering some cold stale pizza by the slice   I wish they had more healthier options and more vegetarian options to go with the menu.   I updated it to 4 stars because I was just told of all the wonderful veggie goodness I cab now spend my money on ! Guess where I will be going for dinner !
Pizza is so-so, good hang out place just next door. Weird service.  Went there today, had pear and walnut salad, that was good! The Lime Chicken sandwich was ok.
Nice place to eat in d town. Good and fast service during lunch. The Waiter was good about making sure everything was fine. I usually don't like eating pizza but this place wasn't bad.

I love, love, love the BBQ wings. They always arrive piping hot and the sauce is amazing. They have a wide selection of pizzas. A nice natural crust that is not too thin and crispy, not to thick and doughy. The toppings taste fresh and delicious. The sauce has a very good blend of flavors. I like the American and the Italiano pizzas the best. The calzones are a little greasy, but still tasty.  Delivery times are usually at least 45 to 50 minutes. However, I don't mind to wait for something good.

Went in with date for dinner, our first time inside the restaurant on Thomas and the place looked clean, but not any special decor or anything.  I did order wings and pizza (large) with traditional toppings and two beverages for $35 and paid upfront.  The wings were covered in sauce and turned out well done on the inside but somehow the skin was wet and soggy.  Gross.  The pizza was a thin crust which is good, but it too had lots of "juice" under the center of the pizza making it soggy and the juice looked like black water.  Gross.  A waste of $35!  A side note, the service was so poor from the cashier dude that thinks he should be given a tip before the food is even served.  He also made a verbal comment out loud that he was working for free.  I am sure zpizza has quality ingredients, but the wings made us both sick for the night which means another lost customer telling a hundred others not to visit this hole in the wall.

My wife and I love Zpizza and visited this location for the first time tonight. It was about 6pm and the place was completely empty. We placed our order and I proceeded to get a drink from the soda machine. The dr pepper was empty and was told that they were out but that was after I heard what appeared to be the owner saying " I dont even know how to work this thing".  The pizza took longer than usual to make and it appeared that this was mostly a delivery takeout location. The door said new ownership and it appeared that they have no idea how to run a restaurant.  Some younger teenage/college age kids came in and were helping out behind the counter but they were dressed in tank tops and very short shorts which didn't seem terribly sanitary.  There was some preprinted displays on the table with some information about giving feedback online . We asked a young scantily clad girl behind the counter about the displays but she was obviously clueless about what we were talking about and said as much .... We will only order takeout from now on but I think the health department needs to do some training because no one wants to see some gym rat looking young guy handling food while his underarm hair is showing !!  Food is great but otherwise they need serious help !
Hands down one of the best pizza spots I've eaten at . They claim to be organic which is to good to be true . I highly recommend this place . The staff there is great too
This is my favorite pizza place. I wish the pizza wasn't so expensive, but I understand why it is. I love the Hawaiian and the California Veggie.
Delicious food.  Had the pear gorgonzola flat bread and salad, and my friend had the original calzone.  All was delicious, the staff were friendly.

The rating is because of the gluten-free crust. Anyone who is gluten-free knows pizza is tough to come by. This is my third shot at a gf crust, and it's a ton better than the others. Thin, fairly crispy (not easily done gf) and good. I got the napoli (tomatoes and basil), and they have a bunch of other specialty pies. Very casual and they do slices. A definite pizza stop downtown.

These folks are my heroes. For over a year after first moving downtown I suffered by ordering Pizza Hut for delivery, thinking it was my only option. A neighbor enlightened me. I called Z Pizza. The first time they delivered something to me, I almost wept with joy. You have to understand how much pain and pizzatorture I went through before seeing the Z light.  Not only do they always deliver on time, but their food is among the best I've had anywhere in Phoenix that delivers. I select something different from the menu almost every time I order, and I've yet to be disappointed. The delivery drivers also tend to be cool dudes.

Excellent concept, well executed food, incredibly welcoming manager.   Happened to walk by this great establishment when in Phoenix for a conference and came back multiple times. They've got a pour it yourself tap system that allows you to try their variety of beers/ciders and wines. You get a bracelet that connects to the tap and can see how much you are pouring and stop whenever you like (whether that be 2 oz or 24oz). I enjoyed the patio with a large group and the manager was so welcoming and helpful. The boys loved the pizza and I was so pleasantly surprised with my arugula salad, which was simply perfect. Everyone I interacted with here was so nice and patient, they are really doing something right with this place. Check it out!
Ordered a pesto chicken pasta. Took 25 mins.. Cost $10.. And I'm still hungry. Portion was small for the price. Won't be back. The pizza is ok but better options in the area for less.
I always end up having them deliver so I haven't been inside but the pizza is great! The Thai is my favorite. I love being able to get pizza that isn't horrible for you!

I cant attest for the pizza but the salads here are pretty decent. I had the ZBQ Salad which was super fresh and tasty! The Mr had one of there new rustic pizza's which he said was pretty good. I swear, he needs to start Yelping as well! Anyhoo.. very good for a quick lunch.. PLUS, they totally carry Sweat Leaf Tea.. good stuff!!

Only 2 Stars: Z-Pizza on Thomas: Haven't been here in a while because we have been going to the nearby FIRED PIE at Park Central instead, which is waaaay better!  But I received an e-mail for a free small pizza for my birthday, so we decided to return to z-pizza for that. I ordered the Thai Pizza & was disappointed....  The peanut sauce lacked any yummy flavor, quite bland, & it was missing one of the toppings that it was supposed to have....no carrots. I complained up at the counter, & to compensate, they gave me a free drink. That was nice of them, but they should have told me up front, & not assume that I wouldn't realize that one of the toppings was missing, because I used to get the Thai Pizza all the time & I remember lots of carrots on it!  There was hardly any red onions or bean sprouts on it either!  However, there was a fair amount of chicken on it.  I will not be returning to z-pizza again.  FIRED PIE, here we come!~  Also, the chairs make a LOT of noise there when they're moved around...annoying!

I truly feel like an idiot, I truly do.  Spending so much time in California I would have THOUGHT I would have heard of this place but no, I was too focused on Paisanos in Hermosa Beach to actually realize that there were other DELICIOUS pie eateries around.   Only until I mosey on into Phoenix and start noticing these places and the always crowded parking lots surrounding them.  And, only until my cheap ass is offered a complimentary 14" pizza do I actually try the joint.  AWESOME, simply AWESOME!!   If your a meat lover, GREAT, if your a cheese lover, GRREEAT, and if you are a veggie lover GRRRRREEEEAAATTT! (That was my Tony the Tiger voice)   You won't be disappointed, other than the bill, buy hey, fresh quality stuff is worth the Washington's, even if we are in a recession.   Put it this way, you can get the crust baked with Truffle oil for Christ's sake, how BADASS is that??

deliciouso....great crispy, slightly burnt edges. they weren't frugal with the toppings and were more than willing to add or take away any sauce or topping as we wanted. very friendly staff and quick. cool artwork on the walls, and extremely reasonable for the middle class foodie.   several valley locations so check one out in a neighborhood near you. then head next door for a tasty ice cream treat.

ALERT ALERT!!! the food here has made me sick  with food poisoning twice now. the second time 06/30/14 i had to go to the st josephs emergency room. bad  creepy attitude from the night employee courtney or casey.  i believe she tampered with my food. the manager dave is an absolute disgusting human being. noone willingly apologized, very reluctant to give refund. i do not recommend to anyone!!!! - Registered Nurse
I always like to stop in here and get artichokes pizza, they have really good toppings here to choose from.

Soggy gluten free pizza with a steep upcharge for gluten free. They don't tell you about upcharge or what it is. It was about double what is usual. Apathetic staff. I would not chance it if I were celiac. Shared kitchen. Staff really could not be bothered to speak and seemed genuinely irritated that I would ask a question about the sauces on some of the pizzas. They never even asked if I wanted a beverage.  Pizza not worth price. Sauce has best gf pizza. I would buy a frozen  gf pizza at a store before having this again.

It's pretty tasty stuff! They offer some interesting pizzas and the ingredients are usually pretty fresh. Sometimes if you go in at kind of a slow hour and get a slice, it'll be a little on the 'meh' side. The calzones are pretty good, they'll fill the craving if you have one.  Honestly what I am a big fan of at zPizza is their sandwiches and salads. They're flavorful, fresh, and the bread is awesome. The salads have interesting combinations and are a nice size.   Hit Pink Spot next door afterward for maximum gluttony.

**FINAL UPDATE**12/11/14 I never received a reply from Brandi Babb. I would consider this closed after this much time. This company is horrible even at a corporate level.     10/23/14 I was able to make contact with the corporate offices of Zpizza. A woman named Brandi Babb sent me an email asking how she could help. I have detailed to her all of my updates and information about my experience and how little this location has done to make the situation right. I will post her response once I have received it.   UPDATE 10/18/14 I just received an email from the BBB advising they still have not received a response over a month later. BBB has closed the case and states this will have an "adverse" effect on ZPizza's rating. I was provided horrible service and even worse product and still, I was not refunded. Great job ZPizza. You've shown what type of business you really are.    UPDATE 10/10/14 I just got an email from the Better Business Bureau and they say ZPizza still has not responded to them. ZPizza also has not made an attempt at contacting me. BBB will give them more time to respond before closing the complaint.    UPDATE 09/17/14 I have filed my complaint with the Better Business Bureau today. I waited over a week for zpizza to call back and they didn't. I called them 09/16/14 and spoke with a nice girl named Harley who gave my information to the GM. The GM called me back on 09/17/14 and left a voicemail and didn't give his name. He defended what Sean, the manager in training, told me and said they won't refund me since I waited until the next day to file my complaint. He said "this is the end game" and declined my refund request. They've wasted more money responding to my complaints than the pizza is worth. Update coming soon....   UPDATE 09/10/14: I contacted corporate and they have forwarded an email to the owner resolve the issue within 48 hours.   UPDATE 09/09/14 ZPizza is making it impossible to get my refund. The manager, Sean, said, at the time of my call, that it's been "almost 24 hours" since I was there so they can't refund. I went to ZPizza right after work to submit my complaint. It had been maybe 17 to 18 hours. He says the sauce is organic so it evaporates into the cheese. He says the pizza was cooked even though it was cold and the vegetables were raw. I am waiting for his callback since he has to check with the owner to get approval for a refund. As a business owner, why hire a manager if you give them no power? They offered me a free pizza which I declined. I hate this place and don't want to eat there again. I want my money back. Next step is corporate and then the BBB.   -------ORIGINAL REVIEW-------  What a terrible experience. To order, it took the order taker at least 5 minutes because he didn't know the computer. He was dressed differently from all the other employees. I'm guessing he was a supervisor.   I specifically asked him if he would call our name when our order was ready. He said yes and said it'd be ready in 15 minutes. We waited 25. When I got tired of sitting around, I walked up to the register and the man seemed surprised and very quickly handed my order to me. It had been ready for an amount of time but we were never called.   Got home, cheese was rubbery. Ingredients were undercooked. Also, NO PIZZA SAUCE. What's wrong with these people? I put it in my oven for 10 minutes and it looked better. Taste was a 2 on a 10 scale. Again, no sauce. I would have gone back but, after waiting 20 minutes for my order, I was starving and didn't want to turn a simple pizza trip into a one hour ordeal. I posted some pictures of my pizza for the skeptics. I read good things about this place and am greatly disappointed. Over $20 for one large pizza and this is what I got?

I tried a pepperoni pizza with extra cheese from zpizza on Sunday. It was just ok. Pretty dry as there was not much sauce under the cheese and extra cheese didn't quite reach the real extra cheese level to me. If my pizza was extra cheese, I'd hate to see what a regular amount of cheese would be. My last bite seemed to have all the sauce I wished would have been in each bite. At $18.95 (including tax) for a one item with extra cheese thin crust 14"  pizza, definitely not worth the price despite all the organic claims on the box. However, as organic goes, this wasn't bad by any means. Service was good, they quoted me 15-20 minutes and the pizza was hot and ready when I arrived. The price alone will prevent me from coming back.

I wasn't all that thrilled to go to Z Pizza, because I had remembered having it in Scottsdale before a ton of them shut down and was not a fan. However, I was severely hungry and in a rush to get to a show, so I decided I could tolerate it. Was happy to see the menu had seemed to be revamped since my last visit many years ago. My family ordered a few different things at the counter, and they were delivered pretty quickly, even faster than they had told us, which was awesome since we were short on time! We got garlic bread and the arugula salad (without walnuts) to start. The salad was absolutely delicious. The caramelized onion with the parmesan and arugula was a terrific flavor combination! The garlic bread was soooo good too, yummy cheese melted on top. Only complaint was that the marinara sauce was like cold. Not even room temperature. Like fresh out of the fridge cold. Thought that was a little odd. The meat eating portion of my family also shared some kind of lime chicken sandwich which they loved, and a chicken sausage, which was also eaten pretty quickly haha. For my main meal I got a veggie calzone. I must say, this was the only thing that I was really disappointed with. The crust was very good, but it was just super watery from the ricotta. Also it was like overflowing with red peppers. I love red bell peppers, but it was just totally overpowering. It was served with icy cold marinara sauce as well. Weird! If I'm in the area I will gladly come back to Z pizza, as all the food (with the exception of the veggie calzone) was super good, customer service was good too.

I cannot comment on their food because it never arrived.  Despite multiple phone calls and repeated reassurances the pizza was never delivered. I canceled after 2 hours. Invest in a place that actually invests in their customers. This is not such a place.
After placing an order online through Grubhub and buying a Groupon, I came to discover (only by driving down there) that this location is no longer open.
The staff is very friendly! This is my go to place for a little bit more formal type of  hang. Their wings are delicious, and their chicken pizza is the best!

I'm not going to even compare Z Pizza to NY pizza because they are completely different. For lunch Z Pizza is a decent choice...the times I have been there service is quick and there is plenty of seating to be had. The parking lot is really small and fills up quickly, but don't let that deter you.  The first time I went for lunch I had the pasta with grilled chicken, pinenuts, and basil pesto. For the most part it was a good dish even though the pasta was a tad overcooked. It wasn't an overly large portion, but was the perfect amount for lunch.  I believe the pasta and a drink was close to $10.  I have also had the Moroccan pizza (pesto, feta cheese, pinenuts, and eggplant) which was very tasty although it could have used a bit more feta. For a slice of the Moroccan, a garden salad, and a drink, it was $8.  Some of my coworkers who I dine with also enjoy the calzone (you will have to wait about 10 minutes for it though) and the Santa Fe pizza.  I'm not really a fan of gourmet pizza, but for a lunch spot downtown it is not bad. It's not my first choice but not a place I drag my heels to go to either. The one good thing about this Z Pizza location is that they will deliver at night to the State Capitol which we had them do once this fall when we were working late.

The pizza is excellent. I had one issue with a mis-marked pizza out of their display case recentlyof "by the slice": it was chicken barbecue which I cannot eat (I HATE chicken barbecue pizza) but the sign said "Neapolitan" too late as I had already taken it home.    I went in (May 20th) for a birthday lunch, and was disappointed in the experience. Me and my sister were enjoying our pizzas and one of the staff, seated a full two tables away watching television in the dining area- for some reason was listening in to our conversation! then joined in of his own accord. We politely replied with small talk and went on speaking more quietly to ourselves, which he then later again opined on of our comments which were not of his concern. It was very awkward being forced to entertain a person that I hadn't planned on speaking with. I am sure he thought he was being "friendly" but most paying customers do not appreciate the staff interrupting the customer and joining in their conversations.   The cashier also refused to enter in my phone number which gives the customer a free large pizza when they've spent a certain amount there. I wonder if he input someone elses number?   All of the staff seem to have tattoos all over the place- their arms, legs, what have you. Tattoos aren't cool anymore but I guess they are permanently stuck wearing them.

It's good but not extraordinary. Service is always great, food is always made fast. It's definitely better than your average pizza, but compared to some of the pizza out there, I've become desensitized to gourmet pizza.

I stopped in their last night right before I hit up the Jamie Foxx concert at the Dodge Theater. It's a cute little place. Very, clean and quite quiet on a Thursday evening. But then again it was technically after hours (7pm) in the downtown area so unless major is going on it just may be like this all the time.   The guy that took care of me was really sweet. I wish I would have gotten his name. He was patient as I was trying to decide on the only slice of pizza I wanted. LOL In the end I choose a huge slice of piping hot pepperoni and for under $3.00 for my slice, not to shabby.   I sat myself down and watched some of the college football game and enjoyed my wonderfully delicious slice of pepperoni pizza. I swear their was pepperoni in ever bite. It wasn't greasy and the crust was just perfect. He even checked up on me to make sure I didn't want a second slice. My mind was screaming YES, YES but alas I was good and politely declined.  Very friendly, very clean, great prices and damn good pizza. They have tons of specials so you can't go wrong. Check this place out if you haven't already.
good pizza, especially with the soy cheese and fake meat options.  great addition to the area.

The service is beyond excellent and amazing, Alexander tended to my family as if we were already friends and made sure we were satisfied with our choice of beers and easily tossed aside what we didn't like with no discrepancy. Very happy and satisfied!

Just ordered from here. We got the wings and Mediterranean Platter. Took about an hour which was expected but we noticed we didn't get the hummus. When I called they said the driver tried calling to tell us they were out of hummus. He didn't call. He didn't tell me when he handed me the food at the door.

Soo yummy!  I agree with the fact that parking can be a pain here, but its worth it.  Or, what a lot of people don't realize is that they deliver!  The pizza is a little pricey, but for the different toppings and styles they make, it's totally worth it.  Personally, I don't really like red sauce, so it's nice to find a pizza that doesn't have that as its main ingredient.  Come here (or get delivery) if you are looking for a non-traditional pizza that you want to really enjoy!

After coming to Z for the last 1.5 years, I have to reduce my overall score. This is long overdo.  Not sure what has happened there but the pizza is just not the same as before (see last review).  Issues are quality of pizza and price and my experience tonight solidified my less than stellar review.   Ordered to large pizzas: one Greek and one plain cheese, plus a salad for pick up. Total bill was about 45 bucks! Say what? Cough cough...holy cow!  Got home and low and behold, another feeling of my hard earned money being spent on less than average fare. Pizza dough was chewy and dry. It used to be amazing. Rest of pizza was bland and tasteless. It used to pop with flavor. See the theme here?   I just can't justify spending this kind of $$ on this quality of food. While pizza may not be the cheap alternative to feeding a family any longer, there are a dozen other places I'd rather go, spend half as much and get a pretty decent pie.  So long Z Pizza.

Ordered delivery from this location and I was impressed. I ordered two half salads and a small Provence pizza with chicken sausage.  The pizza was cooked perfectly, and was not soggy at all, despite being delivered. Growing up on the east coast in NY, I am used to and prefer thinner crust pizzas. If you like thin crusts and organic ingredients, ZPizza will not disappoint.   The salads were good too, but they were nothing special.   Overall, I am happy I gave ZPizza a try and will order again!

Z-Pizza (and Carlos) came through for me in a big way during a recent late night work day. I was going on my 13th hour at the office and my hunger pangs were really getting the best of me and the only thing I had in my overhead was a couple sleeves of instant oatmeal and a pack of Cup O' Noodles. I'm soo tired of oatmeal for dinner and I wasn't feeling the Cup O' Noodles either.  My office is downtown so late night delivery options are almost non-existent and being that I was on command center duty, I could not leave my post so it had to be delivery or nada.  Sad thing is, most of the eateries in my downtown nook roll up pavement between 8 and 9pm.  After calling all my favorite daytime eateries (that were still open at 9pm)which either don't offer delivery or stopped delivery at 8pm, I was just about to give up and settle for those expired sleeves of the oatmeal when I thought to give Z-Pizza a try. Sure glad I did! Technically they too were no longer delivering for the night but Carlos was so nice and said he would do it for me. I had my order in and it was delivered within 20 minutes. My salad was crisp and cold and my pasta & meatballs were piping hot. Carlos was just as friendly in person as he was on the phone and thanks to Z-Pizza I was a happy well fed man.

I was visiting Scottsdale this past weekend and looked up a couple places with vegan food.  I was very excited to find out that zpizza offered vegan cheese.  I was extra excited that there was a restaurant.com gift certificate available for $25 off $50.  It sounds like a lot to spend, but if you get 2 pizzas and a salad, it's about that much.  We got a vegan cheese w/ artichoke, mushroom, and olives and a ZBQ for the meat eaters.  Also got a salad w/ balsamic and the hummus platter.  Everything was very good and everyone who took part in this meal was very satisfied.  I'd highly recommend giving it a try.

Excellent menu with numerous options for apps, salads, pizza and more.  The crust is so good and light.   Parking: This location at W Thomas Road has maybe 5-7 spots for parking. However, when we were there, we noted most folks get to -go pizza.   Service:  Fantastic and friendly!  Also, I used a Groupon. Some restaurants are weird with Groupons, but this place was so so friendly!  The man who had made our breadsticks and pizza was always asking if we needed more wine and/or beer.  So friendly!  Food:  I have ordered pizzas here before. The crust is light and tasty. It is light weight but filling.   I ordered the arugula salad, which was a bit heavy on walnuts but ok. The Caesar salad looked super tasty.  The mushroom pizza was light and interesting.   We ordered the parm breadsticks and finished those rather quickly.   The menu indicates that individuals can order gluten free, vegan, or vegetarian as well!   Price: Great prizes for what one can get. Lunch specials are very cheap.
Honestly Dominoes may be better. Pizza was bland and the chicken wings were soggy.  The bread sticks were good but overall I wouldn't eat there again.  Sorry Z Pizza.

Best pizza in Phoenix. The ZBQ is so good. I normally order a half ZBQ half pepperoni and ricotta pizza. Always fresh. And delivery time is quick. There's no reason to go anywhere else for pizza. I love this place.

We live near Z Pizza and have ordered it a number of times recently - it's good - but the reason I'm leaving this review is because I just tried their gluten free pizza tonight, and I'm totally a fan!  I don't have much to compare it with in terms of gf, but I had a third slice ...I just wanted more!  My rating isn't 5 stars because I thought they skimped a bit on the sauce ...but you know I will definitely be back for the gf and I appreciate that they offer it as an option.

The food is much like all other zpizza locations- always good, always fresh and always pretty standard size/taste/portion-wise, etc.   I usually always get the same thing at zpizza, but usually go to the Downtown Phoenix location near CityScape. To my knowledge, I ordered the same thing as usual and with my order and another usual entree, it seemed to be $5-10 more than the CityScape location....which is weird.  The staff is really unprofessional, had awkward "night out" stories that they were loudly telling in front of customers. I had to walk up to the counter and wait to get a box, as I was being seemingly ignored, but one of the employees was eager to help me once he noticed me.  It is conveniently placed near/connected to a dessert/cafe that looks cute, too, but I did not try it.   This place might be better for take-out or delivery, but I'm not sure. It just wasn't as good of an experience as other zpizzas that I have been to.

Well I wasn't blown over but I wasn't disappointed. The pizza is excellent, try the santa fe pizza but ask for extra corn, the staff isn't overly friendly or rude...indifferent maybe what they are or maybe I caught them on a bad night. The decor seems lacking but if you are going to pick up your pie or get it delivered this place may rank at 4 stars. Its a pizza place with a unique twist. Try it out. I'd go again it may not be my first choice but I'd go back.

It should  be call "S"pizza for all the salt they put on their pizzas, we ordered them with light sauce, thin crust, etc. and still was soooo salty we had to throw them away after we ate a few slices. We had tried ordering the same style of pizza from Dominos and Pizza Hut and they were way more edible than what we ordered from Zpizza, We wish more establishments were more aware of the dangers of too much sodium on the products the sell...

Ah, Z.   +1 for the cheap lunch specials +1 for the friendly service and the cute guy at the register with long-ish hair +1 for being open past 6pm in downtown phoenix.  Pizza isn't amazing, but, it's not meant to be.  The salads are pretty delicious, from 2-5 the slices are only $1, PLUS they deliver within a 2 mile radius and don't charge!   If you order enough times (like me, apparently), you get a free large pizza.    Oh yeah, there is alcohol.
This place is quite cool! I love that you can serve your own beer and try all the beverages they have on tap. Everything we ordered tasted amazing. What a great experience!
Ordered the casa blanca and mexican pizza  for lunch in the office. Even on a Sunday, the food was fresh,delivered fast and SOOOO filling... literally I had one piece and was full!

I love mom and pop shops and especially when it's pizza! It made it even better that they have a vegan option! It is a pretty small establishment though; cozy, but I think I'd rather get my food to go each time because it would seem to be claustrophobic if there were at least 5-10 more people there. Located in midtown, so it's in a great location!   I went with my mom for lunch and it was surprisingly no one else in there (kinda had me skeptical) but I still wanted to try my first vegan pizza. I set my sights on getting ONE slice of pizza, but apparently they only offer the vegan slice if it is one of the pizzas of the day, otherwise you have to buy the whole pie. I was a little disappointed but my mind was set on the pizza so I just ordered the whole pie anyways, and not regretfully!  It took a little longer than expected to get our pizzas since we were the only ones in there but I guess you can't rush perfection right? My mom ordered a slice of the American pizza and a slice of the Bacon Spinach Mushroom pizza and I ordered the Berkeley Vegan pizza. All of the pizzas smelled really good! My pizza was so impressive, I feel like I could get used to vegan pizza and not miss cheese at all! Although the cheese is clearly not the same texture, it tastes more like a thick "sauce" than the hearty cheese that most know and love. Besides the cheese, all the other flavors were there and went well together! You could (almost) not taste the difference from a regular pizza. My mom really favored the Bacon Spinach Mushroom pizza with the white sauce and artichokes, she said both were good but that one was REALLY good.   I really enjoyed this place and wouldn't mind coming back again to order the vegan pizza, it will just take some getting used to the "cheese" texture! Customer service was great, they were helpful and I love when the staff makes suggestions. Although the cashier seemed a little new and took awhile to ring up our order, I appreciate everything the workers did to make it an enjoyable first visit.

Good pizza! Service was subpar. They gave out table numbers but you still had to get up and pick up your pizza from the counter. We got wings as well which were very weird. Soft (mushy almost)  and not much sauce.  Probably won't return, but who knows? Wasn't terrible enough to disregard this place forever.

Last week, my friend and I went to Z Pizza and had some great thin crust pizzas. She called in the order and asked about the crust being gluten free, which it is. (That was only for a FYI purpose, not because we wanted gluten free). When she placed the order the person let her know that something we got as a topping was not gluten free, which was totally OK with us. She got a call back later from another person letting her know the same info. That is a good customer service touch and we both wanted to give Z Pizza a shout out for taking care of their customers. Plus...their pizzas are really yummy!

Z Pizza is definitely in the a-ok realm for me.  I like that they have wheat crust available and that is centrally located.  Other than that, I think the prices are a bit high and the ordering system/counter area always seems awkward.    Because of the awesome amounts of gourmet pizza available around town, Z Pizza seems to be one of the only places that you can get a quick pizza to go and not have to end up with a Hot and Ready.  Just an a-ok, middle of the road pizza place.

I was recently introduced to Z Pizza and now I can't get enough. I really enjoy the variety they offer but my favorite thing is the pesto sauce!  They rotate through different pizzas that you can get by the slice each day or you can order your favorite full size pizza.  My Kids live this pizza. My picky eater says it is the best pizza she has ever had.
